story:
THE CODIE INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN IS NOW CLOSED

Thank you for your support!

You can pre-order your Codie on our website.

http://getcodie.com

///////

Codie is a new robotic toy that teaches the principles of computer coding, with the mission to help understand how technology works. Codie comes with a unique visual programming language, which organizes the code of robotics into blocks. By arranging these blocks together you create real programs, which are then executed by the toy robot. While playing with Codie, you get to learn about how computers think and get to know the fundamental programming concepts in a fun and playful way.


>>>GO TO OUR WEBSHOP<<< 



Our children need to understand how technology works

Teaching children coding will be useful for the rest of their lives. Learning programming with Codie develops kids' problem solving and critical thinking skills while unleashing their inner creativity. Kids become makers while building their programs with our intuitive application, as creative and colorful as the children using it. We created Codie to provide our youngest and brightest generation the tool they need to acquire the basics of coding.

Featured on


The advanced code of robotics organized into blocks that children can easily arrange to make programs


We created our own programming language to teach kids coding, our application bridges the gap between kids’ imagination and the algorithmic thinking. It’s made possible by using the colorful blocks, and connecting them together with arrows showing the direction of execution. Children can learn the basics of coding using real programming patterns, like if-else structures, variables or loops.

Simple and effortless interface makes programming easy to understand at a glance


The benefits of the touchscreen enables us to create a truly intuitive user interface, and avoiding the need for a keyboard. Every control is designed to be as easy to use as possible. We created plenty of custom controls to give more meaning to numeric parameters.

Separated data flow


To avoid large programs become a confusing mess, we used a new approach: separated data operations. They also look similar to the action blocks, the difference is that the arrows now transfer data between the blocks. Every action block can have it’s data flow, and depend on different calculations for the parameters.


The groundbreaking novelty of the Codie programming language lies in its layered structure. The application gradually introduces different programming concepts, and as kids get to know these more and more complex structures, so do they unlock more possibilities within Codie. Codie grows with you child as they will have new features to explore for a long time.

>>>GO TO OUR WEBSHOP<<< 


Want to know how our app really teaches kids coding? Click here!


A toy robot, to make the whole experience the way kids like it - tangible and real


We imagined the robotic toy as the counterpart of the revolutionary application. Stuffed with the most advanced equipment and thanks to its sturdy build quality, Codie will provide entertainment for the whole family for many hours to come. Codie comes fully assembled, just take it out of the box, pair it with your smartphone via wireless Bluetooth connection and you are ready to go. The Codie body is carved out of high-quality wood and every single unit is hand-crafted in our workshop.




Playful learning

Codie is not just toy, but rather a creative tool, a companion that augments other games. It’s a high-quality learning experience that is fun and provides your kids invaluable skills along the way. With Codie the whole process feels natural and seamless and children get empowered by the knowledge they gain.  It integrates into any game and enables meaningful interactions between kids and real life.

Codie goes way beyond than teaching coding to children. In our interpretation, coding is the understanding of how to use technology flexibly. The ultimate goal is to explain how the building bricks of technology come together to create the world we live in. When your children create their first algorithm in the Codie app, they already made the first step towards unlocking the exciting possibilities that lie in modern technology.


Codie is much more than a robot

Codie is a creative tool that children can use in countless ways. Here are our two favorite examples that our little testers made up.

Children can simply transform Codie into an alarm clock. Codie’s light sensors measure the brightness and when it reaches a level, the buzzer goes off.

Your kid can even learn dance moves with the help of Codie. Just program the steps, tap the play and let the party begin!


We would be happy to hear about what your child has turned Codie into!

While playing with Codie, your child will become familiar with logical thinking and problem solving, the skills all interactions with technology is based on


Product design: patterns and feedback

We have conducted some serious user testing with children. The feedback we gained during these tests provided valuable information on how to further develop Codie. Our most important finding was, that easy-to-understand patterns and instant feedback must be the core values of our design. The human mind is constantly looking for patterns everywhere to make sense of it’s surroundings. With Codie your child can see the coding patterns created by them in action right when they tap the play button and this immediate feedback reinforces what they learned.

Technical specifications

>>>GO TO OUR WEBSHOP<<< 


Our story

Codie was envisioned back in 2013, at a startup weekend, where Adam and Andras, our co-founders met. They won first place in the startup competition with the idea for Codie. After taking part in numerous startup events, where Codie was met with enthusiasm, we decided to bring our product to the market. Our proudest moments were when Codie won the national finals of the Microsoft Imagine Cup, and when we were included Kairos Global Summit 2014 Top Ten!

 A fast-paced 54 hour startup frenzy where young creative minds collide to bring new ideas to the world with help of experienced mentors.

One of the biggest startup accelerator programs in Europe, which helps early-stage ventures take their next steps towards success.

An international non-profit organization embracing young entrepreneurs from universities and launching programs in many countries.

The Imagine Cup in an annual competition hosted by Microsoft whose aim is to bring students with a spirit to change the world through technology.

An annual entrepreneurship conference held in Vienna focused on technology and hardware-software development.

Codie underwent a long design process. A lot has changed since Codie’s first iteration.


Our small but committed team comes from different backgrounds, we have engineers, designers, seasoned marketing veterans and even psychologists on board. There’s one thing we all share: the passion for the advancement of technology.

We were introduced to a bunch of young bright girls, who were to apply for the local round of the FIRST LEGO® Leauge LEGO® Mindstorms programming cup. Their commitment was a real inspiration for us and we decided to help them with the preparations. And guess what? With the help of Codie they finished as one of the rewarded teams!

Why we need you

We have a few fully operational prototypes of the robot and have conducted some serious performance testing with them. Codie accomplished the challenge and no misbehavior appeared during those trials. We are sure that the hardware is durable enough to provide countless hours of fun!

The unique new graphic programming language is ready and we have the iOS app in beta testing and we've just begun work on the Android version. With the valuable help of a few schools and a coding-focused local NGO (Skool), we were able to have our product tested by Codie’s real future users: kids. The children loved our app, but we drew some interesting conclusions from the tests and we are tweaking the software based on their feedback.

Codie is almost ready for production. We need your help to go the final mile of bringing Codie to market! We turned to the community of Indiegogo to open our idea to the public, your input and opinions are more than welcome! According to our plans, we should be able to deliver the first Codies by the end of October 2015.



Where your pledge will go


Production timeline

Our production plan has been reviewed and approved by Dragon Innovations.

Codie has been thoroughly reviewed by the team at Dragon Innovation to ensure a sound design and manufacturing plan. We thank the Dragon Innovation team for working with us on verifying that the project is worth bringing to life. We proudly wear the Dragon Certified badge!

>>>GO TO OUR WEBSHOP<<< 



Our team

Adam and Andras are the two founders, they are like ying and yang: totally different, but supplementing each other. There is no Codie without either of them. They are both engineers, so they fully understand the product and at the dawn of Codie, they actually crafted the robot. Now they take care of the business side of the company and Andras continues to develop the app as well.

David and Karoly are the engineering masterminds behind our product, they bring Codie to life. David tinkers with the mechanical design of Codie, from the tiniest screw to the finishing touches of the chassis. Karoly makes sure that something clever goes down inside the shell, he crafts the electronics which power Codie and the firmware that gives the toy its own soul.

Mark and Andras are the true iOS rockstars, they sleep and wake with counting new API features, which can help the development of the Codie app. Creating a new programming language is the dream of every developer, Andras shows the way for the team, and Mark is the one who actually builds the dreams.

Alex and Peter are longtime friends, they have met on the first day of university and have been inseparable since then. Peter is responsible for the visual and UX design, Alex takes care of the marketing and PR. Peter is the creative and calm half of the duo, Alex is rational and buzzing one, but together they make a great team.


Matt has been focused on Mobile for his entire career. He loves world travel and spends his time in San Francisco and Budapest helping companies ship amazing products. 

Frequently Asked Questions

Where do you ship Codie? What are the shipping costs?
We're shipping Codie around the world, but the shipping prices depend on where you live. Don’t forget to add the correct amount under ’Additional gift’ when you’re ordering Codie! The costs are:

  • USA, Canada, Europe: $30
  • Australia and New Zealand: $40
  • Rest of the world: $45
  • Hungary: $8

What is the recommended age group for Codie?
We've designed Codie to be fun for a broad age group. Our robot offers something to explore to kids from the age of 5 and even adults enjoyed playing with Codie very much. Nevertheless, our main age group is kids 8-12 of age.

Why the wood?
We felt that for you - the backers who kindly support us during the campaign - we would like to give something special. A mass produced molded plastic chassis is not special. But a toy robot made out of articulated wood? That’s something. Also, all of our little wooden Codies are assembled by hand.

Isn’t this less environment-friendly?
Actually, the environmental footprint of making a wooden chassis is less than using huge industrial machines to manufacture plastic ones and it produces less non-degrading industrial waste.

Is the wood sensitive to liquids and dirt?
We did our best to minimize the possible permanent damage. Codie is treated with child-friendly water based, protective wood stain to make the wood more resistant to everyday use.

How fragile is Codie?
The wood what makes up Codie is very tough material, even more than the traditional types of plastics. Also, we designed the chassis so that it is durable and contains few weak spots. So you shouldn’t worry more for Codie than for any other toy.

Do I need batteries for Codie?
No! The powerful integrated battery provides the juice needed. You can charge Codie with the included fast charger wall adapter.

Why can't I charge from USB?
USB charging is convenient, but - we must all admit - slow. Especially when charging devices with large batteries. Codie has a larger capacity battery than most smartphones. If you had to charge Codie with USB, it could take up to eight hours. With our dedicated fast charger wall adapter, you can charge Codie in less than two hours.

How big is Codie?
The dimensions of Codie are 11.6cm x 10cm x 4cm/4.6in x 3.9in x 1.6in.

Is Codie safe for my child?
Codie is designed with kids in mind, so the accidents from unintended use are less likely. Nonetheless, we designed it with utter care for child safety: no sharp edges, a size fit for the hands of children, very few removable parts, child-friendly water based wood stain.

Will Codie work on carpet?
Depends on the carpet! Low pile and dense carpets are no obstacle to Codie, as the tracks can stay on the surface.
However the high pile, loosely-knit carpets, especially the cut-pile ones ("shag" or "frieze") probably will trap Codie as he sinks into the soft surface.
But who knows? We might be able to make the situation better eg. with some special carpet crawler tracks. ;)
Here are some examples:
Codie will happily run on these:

...but will probably struggle on these:

...and will be definitely stuck in these:

Is the Codie app available to my device?
We want to bring the Codie app to a wide variety of devices. So far we have the beta version of the iOS app ready, and the Android support is underway as well. At the time of shipment, the following devices and configurations are definitely going to be supported:

Apple
  • iPhone 5 and newer
  • iPad 3rd generation and newer
  • all iPad Minis
  • iPod Touch 5th generation
Android

We will support only Android 4.4 (KitKat) and newer, and only devices with Bluetooth 4.0 (and up).

We will thoroughly test our app on the following devices:
  • phone
    • Galaxy S5
    • LG G3
    • Google Nexus 5
    • HTC One
  • tablet
    • Galaxy Tab 4.7
    • Nexus 9
    • Galaxy Note Pro

This confirmed compatibility list will grow as we test additional devices after release. If you have a different device with Bluetooth 4.x with Android 4.4+ installed, chances are that our app will work. We appreciate every feedback!

What if I have problems with Codie?
Codie is designed with durability in mind, but if you experience any problem, just contact us and we’ll do everything to fix your problem!

Can you ship Codie to my country?
We can ship around the world, but the costs may vary depending on your location. See the first question for details.

When will Codie be ready for shipping?
According to our plans, we’ll start shipping the final Codies in November 2015. In the meantime we will always keep you up-to-date where we’re in developing Codie.

What is customized Codie exactly?
If you choose the 'Customized Codie' perk, we will contact you for the details on what you would like to see on your custom Codie. Codie has a wooden shell made from plywood, cut with laser. We can engrave almost any graphics or text into the chassis of Codie. Generally this means a logo or a name at a few places. Although if you dream of something more complex and artistic, like a full-body tattoo for Codie, send us your idea or draft, we can provide you with the cut outline of the chassis and such, and we discuss what is possible, and what isn't. Looking forward for your ideas to dress up Codie!

Can I get multiple perks?
Of course! You can support our campaign as many times as you want!

How can I order Codie?
At this stage, Codie is only available through Indiegogo. Just choose a perk which comes with a Codie!

How can I contact you?
You can reach us via Facebook, Twitter, e-mail (info@getcodie.com), our website (getcodie.com) or by just simply leaving a comment here on Indiegogo.



The educational layers of Codie

Take me back where I've been before!

To avoid large programs become a confusing mess, we used a new approach: separated data operations. They also look similar to the action blocks, the difference is that the arrows now transfer data between the blocks. Every action block can have it’s data flow, and depend on different calculations for the parameters.

The groundbreaking novelty of the Codie programming language lies in its layered structure. The application gradually introduces different programming concepts, and as kids get to know these more and more complex structures, so do they unlock more possibilities within Codie. Codie grows with you child as they will have new features to explore for a long time.

>>>GO TO OUR WEBSHOP<<< 



Want to know how our app really teaches kids coding? Click here!




A toy robot, to make the whole experience the way kids like it - tangible and real



We imagined the robotic toy as the counterpart of the revolutionary application. Stuffed with the most advanced equipment and thanks to its sturdy build quality, Codie will provide entertainment for the whole family for many hours to come. Codie comes fully assembled, just take it out of the box, pair it with your smartphone via wireless Bluetooth connection and you are ready to go. The Codie body is carved out of high-quality wood and every single unit is hand-crafted in our workshop.











Playful learning



Codie is not just toy, but rather a creative tool, a companion that augments other games. It’s a high-quality learning experience that is fun and provides your kids invaluable skills along the way. With Codie the whole process feels natural and seamless and children get empowered by the knowledge they gain.  It integrates into any game and enables meaningful interactions between kids and real life.

Codie goes way beyond than teaching coding to children. In our interpretation, coding is the understanding of how to use technology flexibly. The ultimate goal is to explain how the building bricks of technology come together to create the world we live in. When your children create their first algorithm in the Codie app, they already made the first step towards unlocking the exciting possibilities that lie in modern technology.



Codie is much more than a robot
Codie is a creative tool that children can use in countless ways. Here are our two favorite examples that our little testers made up.


Children can simply transform Codie into an alarm clock. Codie’s light sensors measure the brightness and when it reaches a level, the buzzer goes off.

Your kid can even learn dance moves with the help of Codie. Just program the steps, tap the play and let the party begin! 





We would be happy to hear about what your child has turned Codie into!
While playing with Codie, your child will become familiar with logical thinking and problem solving, the skills all interactions with technology is based on




Product design: patterns and feedback



We have conducted some serious user testing with children. The feedback we gained during these tests provided valuable information on how to further develop Codie. Our most important finding was, that easy-to-understand patterns and instant feedback must be the core values of our design. The human mind is constantly looking for patterns everywhere to make sense of it’s surroundings. With Codie your child can see the coding patterns created by them in action right when they tap the play button and this immediate feedback reinforces what they learned.




Technical specifications


>>>GO TO OUR WEBSHOP<<< 




Our story
Codie was envisioned back in 2013, at a startup weekend, where Adam and Andras, our co-founders met. They won first place in the startup competition with the idea for Codie. After taking part in numerous startup events, where Codie was met with enthusiasm, we decided to bring our product to the market. Our proudest moments were when Codie won the national finals of the Microsoft Imagine Cup, and when we were included Kairos Global Summit 2014 Top Ten!





A fast-paced 54 hour startup frenzy where young creative minds collide to bring new ideas to the world with help of experienced mentors.





One of the biggest startup accelerator programs in Europe, which helps early-stage ventures take their next steps towards success.




An international non-profit organization embracing young entrepreneurs from universities and launching programs in many countries.




The Imagine Cup in an annual competition hosted by Microsoft whose aim is to bring students with a spirit to change the world through technology.




An annual entrepreneurship conference held in Vienna focused on technology and hardware-software development.




Codie underwent a long design process. A lot has changed since Codie’s first iteration.



Our small but committed team comes from different backgrounds, we have engineers, designers, seasoned marketing veterans and even psychologists on board. There’s one thing we all share: the passion for the advancement of technology.
We were introduced to a bunch of young bright girls, who were to apply for the local round of the FIRST LEGO® Leauge LEGO® Mindstorms programming cup. Their commitment was a real inspiration for us and we decided to help them with the preparations. And guess what? With the help of Codie they finished as one of the rewarded teams!






Why we need you 
We have a few fully operational prototypes of the robot and have conducted some serious performance testing with them. Codie accomplished the challenge and no misbehavior appeared during those trials. We are sure that the hardware is durable enough to provide countless hours of fun!
The unique new graphic programming language is ready and we have the iOS app in beta testing and we've just begun work on the Android version. With the valuable help of a few schools and a coding-focused local NGO (Skool), we were able to have our product tested by Codie’s real future users: kids. The children loved our app, but we drew some interesting conclusions from the tests and we are tweaking the software based on their feedback.
Codie is almost ready for production. We need your help to go the final mile of bringing Codie to market! We turned to the community of Indiegogo to open our idea to the public, your input and opinions are more than welcome! According to our plans, we should be able to deliver the first Codies by the end of October 2015.






Where your pledge will go




Production timeline

Our production plan has been reviewed and approved by Dragon Innovations.
Codie has been thoroughly reviewed by the team at Dragon Innovation to ensure a sound design and manufacturing plan. We thank the Dragon Innovation team for working with us on verifying that the project is worth bringing to life. We proudly wear the Dragon Certified badge!


>>>GO TO OUR WEBSHOP<<< 





Our team


Adam and Andras are the two founders, they are like ying and yang: totally different, but supplementing each other. There is no Codie without either of them. They are both engineers, so they fully understand the product and at the dawn of Codie, they actually crafted the robot. Now they take care of the business side of the company and Andras continues to develop the app as well.


David and Karoly are the engineering masterminds
behind our product, they bring Codie to life. David tinkers with the mechanical
design of Codie, from the tiniest screw to the finishing touches of the
chassis. Karoly makes sure that something clever goes down inside the shell, he
crafts the electronics which power Codie and the firmware that gives the toy
its own soul.






Mark and Andras are the true iOS rockstars,
they sleep and wake with counting new API features, which can help the
development of the Codie app. Creating a new programming language is the dream
of every developer, Andras shows the way for the team, and Mark is the one who
actually builds the dreams.



Alex and Peter are longtime friends, they have
met on the first day of university and have been inseparable since then. Peter
is responsible for the visual and UX design, Alex takes care of the marketing
and PR. Peter is the creative and calm half of the duo, Alex is rational and
buzzing one, but together they make a great team.



Matt has been focused on Mobile for his entire career. He loves world travel and spends his time in San Francisco and Budapest helping companies ship amazing products. 

Frequently Asked Questions

Where do you ship Codie? What are the shipping costs?
We're shipping Codie around the world, but the shipping prices depend on where you live. Don’t forget to add the correct amount under ’Additional gift’ when you’re ordering Codie! The costs are:




USA, Canada, Europe: $30

Australia and New Zealand: $40

Rest of the world: $45

Hungary: $8



What is the recommended age group for Codie?
We've designed Codie to be fun for a broad age group. Our robot offers something to explore to kids from the age of 5 and even adults enjoyed playing with Codie very much. Nevertheless, our main age group is kids 8-12 of age.

Why the wood?
We felt that for you - the backers who kindly support us during the campaign - we would like to give something special. A mass produced molded plastic chassis is not special. But a toy robot made out of articulated wood? That’s something. Also, all of our little wooden Codies are assembled by hand.
Isn’t this less environment-friendly?
Actually, the environmental footprint of making a wooden chassis is less than using huge industrial machines to manufacture plastic ones and it produces less non-degrading industrial waste. 
Is the wood sensitive to liquids and dirt?
We did our best to minimize the possible permanent damage. Codie is treated with child-friendly water based, protective wood stain to make the wood more resistant to everyday use.
How fragile is Codie?
The wood what makes up Codie is very tough material, even more than the traditional types of plastics. Also, we designed the chassis so that it is durable and contains few weak spots. So you shouldn’t worry more for Codie than for any other toy.

Do I need batteries for Codie?
No! The powerful integrated battery provides the juice needed. You can charge Codie with the included fast charger wall adapter.

Why can't I charge from USB?
USB charging is convenient, but - we must all admit - slow. Especially when charging devices with large batteries. Codie has a larger capacity battery than most smartphones. If you had to charge Codie with USB, it could take up to eight hours. With our dedicated fast charger wall adapter, you can charge Codie in less than two hours.
How big is Codie?
The dimensions of Codie are 11.6cm x 10cm x 4cm/4.6in x 3.9in x 1.6in.

Is Codie safe for my child?
Codie is designed with kids in mind, so the accidents from unintended use are less likely. Nonetheless, we designed it with utter care for child safety: no sharp edges, a size fit for the hands of children, very few removable parts, child-friendly water based wood stain.

Will Codie work on carpet?
Depends on the carpet! Low pile and dense carpets are no obstacle to Codie, as the tracks can stay on the surface.
However the high pile, loosely-knit carpets, especially the cut-pile ones ("shag" or "frieze") probably will trap Codie as he sinks into the soft surface.But who knows? We might be able to make the situation better eg. with some special carpet crawler tracks. ;)Here are some examples:
Codie will happily run on these:
...but will probably struggle on these:
...and will be definitely stuck in these:


Is the Codie app available to my device?
We want to bring the Codie app to a wide variety of devices. So far we have the beta version of the iOS app ready, and the Android support is underway as well. At the time of shipment, the following devices and configurations are definitely going to be supported:
Apple

iPhone 5 and newer
iPad 3rd generation and newer
all iPad Minis
iPod Touch 5th generation

Android
We will support only Android 4.4 (KitKat) and newer, and only devices with Bluetooth 4.0 (and up).
We will thoroughly test our app on the following devices:

phone

Galaxy S5
LG G3
Google Nexus 5
HTC One

tablet

Galaxy Tab 4.7
Nexus 9
Galaxy Note Pro


This confirmed compatibility list will grow as we test additional devices after release. If you have a different device with Bluetooth 4.x with Android 4.4+ installed, chances are that our app will work. We appreciate every feedback!
What if I have problems with Codie?
Codie is designed with durability in mind, but if you experience any problem, just contact us and we’ll do everything to fix your problem!
Can you ship Codie to my country?
We can ship around the world, but the costs may vary depending on your location. See the first question for details.
When will Codie be ready for shipping?
According to our plans, we’ll start shipping the final Codies in November 2015. In the meantime we will always keep you up-to-date where we’re in developing Codie.

What is customized Codie exactly?
If you choose the 'Customized Codie' perk, we will contact you for the details on what you would like to see on your custom Codie. Codie has a wooden shell made from plywood, cut with laser. We can engrave almost any graphics or text into the chassis of Codie. Generally this means a logo or a name at a few places. Although if you dream of something more complex and artistic, like a full-body tattoo for Codie, send us your idea or draft, we can provide you with the cut outline of the chassis and such, and we discuss what is possible, and what isn't. Looking forward for your ideas to dress up Codie!
Can I get multiple perks?
Of course! You can support our campaign as many times as you want!
How can I order Codie?
At this stage, Codie is only available through Indiegogo. Just choose a perk which comes with a Codie!

How can I contact you?
You can reach us via Facebook, Twitter, e-mail (info@getcodie.com), our website (getcodie.com) or by just simply leaving a comment here on Indiegogo.

The educational layers of Codie

Take me back where I've been before!

story:
Hi my name is Ruby and I am 10 years old and I am excited to help out my friend John with raising money for a school in India. He is helping some really great kids in an orphanage there get a bigger school and I want to help them out. Maybe you do too.

All the money I raise will go to help the Maxton Strong School in Banbasa India. They have like 75 kids and their school is too small. If you want to see John's video you can watch it here.


His campaign is called ORPHAN SCHOOL and you can learn more about it on his Indiegogo page if you want to see school plans and see how they're doing. 

If you don't know about this orphanage you can see more about them at their website. it's www.indianorphanage.com

If you want to see more of the kids watch this HAPPY video. John shot it when we was living at the orphanage and it always makes me smile. See how cute the kids are. They look so happy. If we lived closer I bet we'd be friends.


So that's it. If you can help these kids with me that would be great. If you can tell your friends, that is another way to help. Together we can change the world ten dollars at a time.

Thanks to John for helping me set this up and for inspiring me. You rock!

With love

Ruby

story:
Superb Catalyst Academy (SCA), founded in 2007 by Ajay Rimal, is a vision to create a lively, vibrant, happy and safe community for learning; where everybody is treated equally and can strive to reach their full potential, in and out of the classroom.

The Academy is currently running with 350 students from nursery to class 10, age 4-18. At SCA, there is an uncompromising commitment to deliver what is best for our students, it is our aim to offer students an environment that promotes enjoyment in learning. We work to ensure superb achievements with a rounded curriculum that gives all students a balanced education by promoting their spiritual, moral, cultural, mental and physical development in order to prepare them for a successful life. In addition we provide a wide range of opportunities in sports (Wushu Martial Arts), agriculture, environmental education, social sciences, and music.

Education in Nepal is a privilege, SCA  treats education as a right, and serves it to each of students, regardless of sex, caste or economic standing. In Nepal, families will maybe only have sufficient funds for one child’s education, and this usually goes to the male children. It makes sure to provide equal opportunity for male and female students, and includes women’s empowerment in the curriculum.


Besides the ongoing  school project and Great Mothers Program and we have started construction of global home before two months of devastating Earthquake and global Home is in existence however, it has minor cracks, The Global home will be the place for my family to live, volunteers and some disadvantaged children and we can directly participate in welcoming volunteers, exchanging cultures, lifestyles, languages and relation build up among the global people in cross-cultural activities. We can increase our efficiency to make the project succeed. We have upcoming project that EarthBag House and hoping for your help and support to give relief the poor family after devastating earthquake.


We have distributed relief materials to the community people of Khanikhola soon after devastating earthquake and we  also have provided zinc sheets to 79 school children family for temporary shelter. The funds we got from global community through Superb Catalyst Academy world wide support team.


We are nearly there!
Thanks to the generosity and hard work by our supporters around the world, so far, we have made huge progress in the school and surrounding community.

Those who had visited us just one year ago can tell you that today's Superb Catalyst Academy has come a long way, continuing to prosper despite more hard times for our country.

We were blessed to start our Global Home project with the support of great friends before the huge earthquake that devastated our community. And thankfully, due to the good quality of the structure, we have recently resumed work.

The Global Home will provide an earthquake proof, comfortable and peaceful place for volunteers to sleep, eat, relax and enjoy the beauty of Nepal.


We are all very excited to be nearing the opening of our new home - to our past and future volunteers - but first we need your help.

We need further financial assistance to add the finishing touches to the building. The most important thing is connecting the home to water and electricity lines. The home includes hygienic and modern washroom and kitchen facilities. Although these are great investments to ensure the comfort and good health of our volunteers they are expensive.


Therefore, we are turning to our larger global community to ask for your help. Help us to complete the  Global Home. We know the love and support are not only there, but are continuing to grow. Above all, please share the message and evidence of the good works at SCA. Awareness can be the largest contributing factor to positive change, and we hope our network continues to only expand.


Each SCA team sends their love and appreciation in taking the time to read this. If you are interested in helping in any way, shape or form, please refer to the references below.  SCA inclusive nature does not limit itself to only the  school, and vision of the SCA community expands much further than the school grounds in Khanikhola.


Superb Catalyst Academy’s Website

http://superbcatalystacademy.co.nr

Superb Catalyst Academy’s Facebook Page

https://www.facebook.com/SuperbCatalystAcademy

Previous SCA Videos

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yds3GY2nPRY

Network of Superb Catalyst Academy

Superb Catalyst Volunteer and Support Team:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/825608090783065/


Give with Soul:

https://www.facebook.com/givewithSOUL/info


Travelling with a Purpose (SCA’s International Project Director, Carol Baggerman):

https://www.facebook.com/GivingItBackTravelingBeautiful

Creating Sustainable Housing  ( Founded by Ronald Mitchell)

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Creating-sustain...

story:
"It is not fun being a refugee. I was always told go back to where I came from. But I guess it is better than living in a place where your home is destroyed," ~Nawa, 19, Somali refugee in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

Earlier this year, we asked students from 3 different refugee schools in Malaysia to tell a story they wanted to share with the world. Among submissions by many students, we selected the most compelling stories, interviewed the student authors, had Malaysian writers adapt the stories, and found local design students from Taylor's University to illustrate them.

From the voice of the refugee students, we present to you their stories. Mostly about their dangerous journeys from their home country to Malaysia, where they could begin a new life of hope, safety, and the freedom and rights they were denied back in their homeland. We promise these stories of strength and conviction will move your soul and strengthen your belief in the human spirit.

HOW YOUR PURCHASE HELPS

The book will be published in Early 2016 in print and ebook form. 50% of proceeds will be given back to the 3 refugee schools these students attend, and 50% will be used to fund future projects aimed to publish more books to share valuable and inspiring stories from underprivileged communities.

As a contributor to this project, we would be deeply touched by a generous gift of any size to help further bring this community's untold stories to the world. To publish 1000 books for distribution, we are seeking to raise RM 10,000. We have 4 packages here: a) eBook - RM 29, b) printed copy - RM 39, and two special packages: c) printed copy of a book + school supplies for 5 kids - RM 99;  d) printed version of a book + salary for one volunteer teacher - RM 599. 

If you want your printed copy mailed to anywhere outside of Malaysia, you'll also need to purchase the option for international shipping. We will contact you before shipment in January for your desired address. Any donation of any size would be greatly appreciated - we thank you deeply for your support. 

"To learn about the plight of refugees is not just a humane thing to do," says Jeanette Chan, co-founder and head teacher of Pandawas Academy for Afghan and Iranian refugees. 
"You never know when one day you might be a refugee. I never know. One day, I might need your help! I never set a permanency in things, after seeing so much. Our students and their parents would never have guessed they would have had to leave Afghanistan, their home for centuries. We take for granted that this is my land, my country, my everything. That we have a right to be here. But what if we have to leave when that moment comes? That made me change my perspective on things. To never take anyone or anything for granted."

MORE ON STORIES FROM

story: All too often students buy books for a high price and are stuck with them when they have no more use for them. When they try to sell their books back, either the bookstore will not except their book or the store will offer them a ridiculously low price. BLT is the solution to these woes, however! With BLT, students can buy, lend, or trade books with each other conveniently and more efficiently. This app also provides a great service for those who cannot afford to purchase books; with the lend option a student can borrow a book for a period of time, agreed upon by both the lender and borrower, for a low cost. There will be security measures to make sure that both lender and borrower are safe. The app will provide a nifty messaging feature to allow individuals to communicate without giving out personal information other than their name and college. Those who use the app will be rewarded with BLT cash which will allow them to purchase brand new books for a cheaper price.

story:
Camp LuWiSoMo is a Christian camp in central Wisconsin where, we touch the lives of children from all over the state. Children are provided with the opportunity to explore the outdoors, all within a loving Christian environment.  Camp LuWiSoMo has been pursuing this goal for the past 50+ years, with a new emphasis to focus our efforts year round in hopes of supplying our summer camp with the necessary materials to assist the youth of Wisconsin, and beyond.

Letting kids explore God, nature, and themselves has become the mission of Camp LuWiSoMo. We want to make sure that if a child wishes to come to camp, they have the ability to do so. 

 When a child goes to camp they get to do something that they may never be able to do in a city, explore! 

By attending a summer camp, a child grows and becomes stronger. Through their exploration they are able to build confidence and self-worth. Realizing that they can accomplish what they set their mind to. 

Camp offers them the environment to grow within these different areas. Yet, they are not completely alone, even though they may think they are. Camp offers a contained safe environment with an invisible safety-net thus giving them the opportunity to accomplish tasks on their own, and be helped when and if they need it. Take for example this young girl who attended Camp LuWiSoMo this past summer:

“Deedee was an eight year old first time camper. Actually, it was her first time away from family, first time out of the "big city," and first time experience with daily devotions and prayer. In less than 24 hours at camp, Deedee was homesick. As her tears flowed, cabin mates offered hugs and encouraging words. Before bed the cabin counselor included Deedee in their prayers. The next day went well for Deedee but soon after supper the homesick feeling and tears returned. Again she received hugs and was included in prayer. Day 3 was a turning point. At the campfire that night Deedee realized she wasn't feeling homesick like she had the past two nights. One of her cabin mates noticed Deedee smiling and asked, "Aren't you homesick tonight?" Deedee's smile got bigger as she said, "No." Her new friend replied, "And that's how God answers prayer." 

Deedee was able to develop and grow personally, through the comfort of her new-found-friends. Situations like this happen all the time, some more extreme cases, and some lesser. 

The hard facts are that it costs roughly $500 for each camper to attend camp. Currently,as a part of our mission work we only ask $400 to attend our 7-day camp. While that price is low, it is not low enough for every household. 

This is why we offer camper scholarships every year to those children who wish to come to camp, but cannot financially afford it. This is where we ask you to help donate. In doing so, you are personally bringing a child to camp, and allowing them to explore God, nature, and themselves.

Camp LuWiSoMo Inc., Mission Statement: LuWiSoMo is dedicated to providing faith-growing opportunities in a Christ- centered outdoor ministry setting for all ages to refresh the whole person through the blessings of people, facilities, and God’s Word. 

Camp LuWiSoMo Inc., is a 501(c)(3) tax exempt non-profit organization.
story_txt: Camp LuWiSoMo is a Christian camp in central Wisconsin where, we touch the lives of children from all over the state. Children are provided with the opportunity to explore the outdoors, all within a loving Christian environment.  Camp LuWiSoMo has been pursuing this goal for the past 50+ years, with a new emphasis to focus our efforts year round in hopes of supplying our summer camp with the necessary materials to assist the youth of Wisconsin, and beyond.Letting kids explore God, nature, and themselves has become the mission of Camp LuWiSoMo. We want to make sure that if a child wishes to come to camp, they have the ability to do so.  When a child goes to camp they get to do something that they may never be able to do in a city, explore! By attending a summer camp, a child grows and becomes stronger. Through their exploration they are able to build confidence and self-worth. Realizing that they can accomplish what they set their mind to. Camp offers them the environment to grow within these different areas. Yet, they are not completely alone, even though they may think they are. story:
Nature Playground...Let’s Do This!

Our children play outside two hours a day. This Spring, we plan to create a safer, natural play space for the children to enjoy everything from blocks to gardening to art AND WE  NEED YOUR HELP!

Our Vision

Our vision is to recreate our outdoor area to be safe, fun, inviting, beautiful and natural. This new outdoor area will serve as a classroom where children can play and discover nature as they garden, pray, build and play. Specifically, we hope to add:

Community Area

  • Goal of Area: Gathering space for small and large groups.
  • Needs: Seats and possibly a small table for snack.
  • Propose: Use wooden stumps for a gathering spot for outdoor learning, reading time and more. Surround with mulch/ground cover and natural barrier. Add a small picnic table for outdoor snack.

Building Area

  • Goal of Area: Cognitive skills, language development and community building.
  • Needs: Outdoor building materials, blocks, tree cookies, sticks, storage for materials.
  • Propose: Purchase Outlast materials from community playthings and storage shed. Open storage from Nature Explore.

Sand Play

  • Goal of Area: Provide sensory experiences that can calm and soothe.
  • Needs: Space for at least 3 children. Protective cover/tarp.
  • Propose: Create sand area in one of the church alcoves enclosed by large rocks that function as seats and barrier for sand.

Dramatic Play

  • Goal of Area: Pretend play. Water play.
  • Needs: Table/simple sink. Pots, pans, scoopers for pouring.
  • Propose: Wooden box with a tub for water or other materials and simple storage shelf for props.

Garden Area

  • Goal of Area: Plant and care for a garden. Add color and living things to area. Life cycle of a plant.
  • Needs: Planters.
  • Propose: Long planter blocking hose area. Wooden box or hideaway around hose.

Garden: Dirt Digging Area

  • Goal of Area: Play in the dirt and mud.
  • Needs: Shovels, buckets, boots.
  • Propose: Designated area for digging. Use one of the current garden areas for dirt.

"Pray-ground"

  • Goal of Area: Create a peaceful place for children and others to pray and be with God.
  • Needs: Soft ground cover, seating, small fountain or water source.
  • Propose: Mulch for ground cover or outdoor rug, Adirondack type chair, small fountain.

Music Play

  • Goal of Area: Make and enjoy music, sounds and movement.
  • Needs: Simple wooden platform for stage, instrument(s).
  • Propose: Put in a simple stage and wooden instrument(s).

Art Area

  • Goal of Area: Offer art supplies and natural materials to create.
  • Needs: Art table, easel and place for storage of art materials.
  • Propose: Use materials we have now, buy table and storage, and add easel and natural items as we go.

Wheeled Toys Track

  • Goal of Area: Gross Motor, Build large muscle strength while promoting balance and coordination.
  • Needs: Hard Surface.
  • Propose: Leave path with brick. Perhaps in a figure 8 or loop.

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you are able to contribute financially, there are still several more ways you can help us make this Nature Playground a reality for our kids:

  • Please share this campaign with friends and family who may be interested in helping us create a safer, more enriching and fun outdoor environment for the kids.
  • We can always use volunteers to help transport materials and build. Please contact Liz Martino (lizeagermartino@gmail.com) for more details.

story:
:::: GERMAN VERSION ::: (To enjoy the english text, please scroll down)


Worum geht’s?
Ganz kurz und ohne BlaBla:
Der Nachfolger meines Buches DIAMONDTIMES soll noch schöner, größer und besser werden. Das geht nur mit Eurer Hilfe – und zwar in
Form von Vorbestellungen und Lust auf wunderbare Extras, die ich zusätzlich liefern werde.
Also: für alle, die TALES OF AN AMERICAN SUMMER gerne hätten – das Buch kann es nur hier und auf diese Weise geben.
Ihr könnt mich Tag und Nacht unter mail@benbernschneider.com erreichen und ausfragen. Ich werde am laufenden Band in Videos und Posts über die Entwicklungen berichten, Bilder und einen Haufen Liebe teilen. Wir sorgen für geballte Vorfreude, bis das Ding da ist.

Und nun mit Hintergrund:
Ich heiße Ben Bernschneider, bin Fotograf aus Hamburg (www.benbernschneider.com) und habe 2014 einen Bildband namens DIAMONDTIMES veröffentlicht. Dieser wurde mir – zum Glück – innerhalb von 7 Tagen restlos aus den Händen gerissen. Und dafür liebe ich jeden Einzelnen von Euch.
Mir wäre wichtig, es mit dem Nachfolger ordentlich krachen zu lassen und das beste Buch überhaupt abzuliefern.

Und dafür brauche ich Leute, die bereits jetzt ein Teil davon sein wollen, Bock auf einen Nachfolger haben und das Ding mit feuchten Händen vorbestellen!

Meine Fotografie wurde letztes Jahr von "colourful, cheeky, joyful" über "sparkling and gritty" bis hin zu "softporn análogo" beschrieben. Für mich ist es ein Mix aus coming-of-age-, college-, high-school-, 80er-Film und einer Portion hedonistischem Jetset- und teen-savoir-vivre-Lifestyle. Das klingt vielleicht scheiße, resultiert aber in schönen analogen Bildern, die mein Herz berühren. C-Heads hat ein paar schöne Worte für DIAMONDTIMES gefunden: Interview.
Anbei ein paar beliebte Beispiele aus DIAMONDTIMES:


Ich bin vielleicht dabei! Wie soll’s laufen?
Ich brauche als allerkleinste Sicherheit: 7.000 Euro.

Nun ja, insgesamt werde ich WEIT mehr als diese aufgerufenen 7.000 Euro brauchen. Der Betrag muss auch noch versteuert werden, außerdem wollen PayPal und IndieGoGo eine Scheibe abhaben.
Aber das wäre die halbe Basis, um das Ding drucken zu lassen.
Um die restlichen Entwicklungs-, Scan-, Druck-, Produktions-, Reise-, Model- und Stylingkosten zu decken, muss ich noch was tun, aber das wichtigste, um es dieses Jahr zu verwirklichen, wären die angestrebten 7 Mille.

Daher würde ich das ganze in Schritten angehen:

  • Bei 7.000 € wird das Buch, wie bereits DIAMONDTIMES, in DIN A5 produziert. Jedoch mit einer höheren Seitenanzahl als 180. 
  • Bei 9.000 € schwenken wir auf DIN A4 um, gehen aber auf Softcover, dafür gehts rauf bis 324 Seiten.
  • Bei 11.000 € gehen wir wieder auf Hardcover UND DIN A4 und senken die Seitenzahl auf 244.
  • Bei allem darüber und erfolgreichen Verhandlungen mit dem Wunschdrucker heben wir die Seitenstärke. YAY!

WICHTIG: sollte das Ziel von 7.000 € nicht erreicht werden bekommen ALLE natürlich automatisch Ihr Geld zurück und ich bin halt traurig.
(Natürlich werde ich nicht heulen. Life‘s a game. Also kein schlechtes Gewissen!)

Klingt geil! Where’s the catch? Risiken?
Butter bei die Fische – ich mache das Buch. Auch wenn ich es, von einem Kojoten halbtot gebissen, produzieren muss. Das einzige Risiko ist das Erscheinungsdatum.

Am liebsten wäre mir ein Produktionszeitraum von Juni-September, Editing im Oktober, Druck im November und im Dezember liegen wir uns alle betrunken mit dem Buch in den Armen.
Notfalls kann ich erst Ende August anfangen. Aber dann muss ich alles ein bisschen verdichten, mir mehr Mitarbeiter dazu holen und mache trotzdem im November den Sack zu. Dieses Buch wird zu 95% im Dezember fertig sein – zu 5% im Januar.
Als zweites Risiko sehe ich den Buchtitel. Es muss in meiner Hand bleiben, das Buch umzubenennen. Falls ich mit einem alten Indianer in einem Tipi sitze und auf Kakteen-Sud plötzlich eine Epiphanie habe, dass das Ding anders heißen muss, muss ich das tun! Habt Verständnis.

Sorry, ich lebe im real existierenden Sozialismus und habe gar kein Geld ODER eigentlich mag ich keine Fotos, keine halbnackten Frauen, keine Palmen und schon gar keine Bücher.
Kein Thema – wir wäre es, wenn du einem Bruder aushilfst und diese crowdfunding Kampagne teilst?! Bei Facebook oder whatever. Wäre super. Und ich würde dich dafür lieben. Und du kannst ganz toll die Tools nutzen, die IndieGoGo dafür bereit gestellt hat. Kinderleicht. DANKE für JEDE Hilfe! <3


_____________________________________________________________________________


:::: ENGLISH VERSION :::

What‘s it about?
In a nutshell and without BlaBla:
The follow-up to my book DIAMONDTIMES should be bigger, better and cooler than ever. And for this I need your help – by pre-ordering, wanting this to happen and looking forward to beautiful extras and perks that I am willing bringing to you pretty people. 
So: for everyone who wants to get his hands on TALES OF AN AMERICAN SUMMER – it‘s only gonna happen here and through this. Ready for some rock‘n‘roll?
You can reach me day and night: mail@benbernschneider.com and ask whatever you want to know. I will post videos and informations on a daily basis about how everything with this campaign is rolling uand I will spread a whole lotta love.

An now with some background:
My name is Ben Bernschneider, I am a photographer from Hamburg, Germany (www.benbernschneider.com) and I have released a book called DIAMONDTIMES in 2014. This little sucker – lucky me – was ripped from my hands in a few days time. For that I love every single on of you dearly.
 Obviously it is important to me that I really deliver with the follow-up.

And for that I need people who are willing to be a part of this adventure and can‘t wait to order this thing.

My photography was titled from "..." over "sparkling gritty" to "softporno analogo". For me it is a eclectic mix of coming-of-age-, college-, high-school-, 80s movies and a pretty handful of teen-savoir-vivre-lifestyle. It might sound shitty but results in pretty analog pictures that truly touch my heart. C-Heads found some beautiful words for DIAMONDTIMES: Interview.
Here some much liked examples from DIAMONDTIMES:


I‘m in! How are we pulling this off?
As a little safety net I will need: 7.000 Euros.

Well, at the end I will be needing MUCH more than this 7.000 Euros that are called for. I‘ll have to pay  taxes and Paypal and IndieGoGo also will want their share.
But it would be a little basis for the printing costs. 
To cover the developing-, scanning-, printing-, production-, travel-, model- and styling expenses I will have to start paying it out of my own pocket for the beginning, but the most important step to getting it done in 2015 is the sum of 7k.

I would do it in following steps:

  • with 7.000 € I would – just like DIAMONDTIMES – produce the thing in the size of 5,83" x 8,27" (DIN A 5). But with more than 180 pages. 
  • with 9.000 € we will swap to 8,27" x 11,69" (DIN A 4), but change it from HARDCOVER to SOFTCOVER and raise the pages up to 324.
  • reaching 11.000 € we will return to Hardcover AND 8,27" x 11,69" (DIN A 4) and lower the pages to 244.
  • with everything above that I will be raising the paper weight to the max. Yes!

IMPORTANT: shouldn‘t we reach the goal of 7.000 € everybody will automatically get their money back. Guaranteed. I will be very sad.
(Of course I won‘t be sad at all. Life‘s a game. So no remorse!)

Sounds f*#+% awesome! Where’s the catch? Risks?
No sugarcoating here – I am doing this book. Even if I am bitten half to death by a coyote, I AM PRODUCING THIS. The only risk is the release date.

I would love to produce it from June to September, editing in October, printing in November and when December arrives we are all drunk lying in each others arms with the book in our hands.
Worst case I will start the main work end of August. But even then I will get myself some more manpower and get it done by November. So this book will to 95% appear in December – and to 5% in January 2016. 
As a second risk I see the book title. It must stay in my will and power to name that book whatever I want it to be. If I find myself sitting in an Tipi with an old Indian tripping on strange ancient drugs having an epiphany that I should name the book something else – I will have to do it so. I hope for your understanding.

Dude, I am a mormon and I don‘t give a crap about money OR I hate pictures, books, half naked girls and palm trees.
Chill, Mate – how about supporting a brother by sharing this little campaign?! On Facebook or whatever. That would be awesome!!! And I would love you for that! Oh, and you can use the tools that indieGoGo prepared for sharing. Easy peasy. THANKS for EVERY little help! <3


::::::::::::::::: THE PERKS :::::::::::::::::::
The tiny package

• Eine eBook-Version von DIAMONDTIMES (2014)
• Ein dickes DANKESCHÖN dafür, dass du Begeisterung zeigst und hier mitmachst!

--------------------------------------------------

• A luxurious eBook version of DIAMONDTIMES (2014)
• A huge THANK YOU for opening your heart and being a part of this!


the eBook package

• Eine eBook-Version von DIAMONDTIMES II (2015)
• Eine eBook-Version von DIAMONDTIMES (2014) 
• Ein dickes DANKESCHÖN, dass du Herz zeigst und hier mitmachst!

--------------------------------------------------

• 1 eBook version of DIAMONDTIMES II (2015)
• 1 eBook version of DIAMONDTIMES (2014) 
• A huge THANK YOU for opening your heart and being a part of this!


The book package

• Eine eBook-Version von DIAMONDTIMES II (2015)
• Eine eBook-Version von DIAMONDTIMES (2014)
• Eine persönliche Postkarte von der USA-Tour
• Ein riesiges DANKESCHÖN noch obendrauf!

--------------------------------------------------

• A beautiful printed DIAMONDTIMES II book!!! 
• 1 eBook version of DIAMONDTIMES II (2015)
• 1 eBook version of DIAMONDTIMES (2014)
• A personal postcard from the trip
• A gigantic THANK YOU on top!

• Du wirst namentlich im Buch erwähnt
• 2 eBook-Versionen: DIAMONDTIMES II (2015) und DIAMONDTIMES (2014)
• Eine persönliche Postkarte aus den USA
• Ein DIAMONDTIMES T-Shirt
• Ein riesiges DANKESCHÖN noch obendrauf!

--------------------------------------------------

• Your name mentioned in the book
• 2 eBook versions: DIAMONDTIMES II (2015) and DIAMONDTIMES (2014)
• A personal postcard from the USA trip.

• A gigantic THANK YOU on top!


The huge package

• Zwei gedruckte Exemplare von DIAMONDTIMES II + beide eBook-Versionen 
• Namentliche Erwähnung im Buch
• Eine persönliche Postkarte aus den USA
• Ein DIAMONDTIMES T-Shirt
• Ein paar gemeinsame Biere (gehen auf mich), jederzeit in Hamburg

--------------------------------------------------

• 2 beautiful printed DIAMONDTIMES II books + both eBooks
• Your name mentioned in the book
• A personal postcard from the USA trip.
• A DIAMONDTIMES-Shirt
• A few beers (on me) whenever your in Hamburg, Germany


The mega package

• 3 Exemplare von DIAMONDTIMES II + beide eBooks
• Erwähnung im Buch + 60x40cm print NACH WAHL!
• Eine persönliche Postkarte aus den USA
• Ein DIAMONDTIMES T-Shirt 
• Ein gemeinsames Essen (geht auf mich), jederzeit in Hamburg

--------------------------------------------------

• 3 DIAMONDTIMES II books + both eBooks
• Mentioned in the book + 60x40cm print OF CHOICE!
• A personal postcard from the USA trip.
• A DIAMONDTIMES-Shirt
• A dinner (on me) whenever your in Hamburg, Germany


The sky is the limit package

• 3 Exemplare von DIAMONDTIMES II + beide eBooks
• Erwähnung im Buch 
• Ein limitiertes (1 von 10) 80x60 Print nach Wahl, Galeriequalität auf Kodak Pro Endura!
• Eine persönliche Postkarte aus den USA
• Ein DIAMONDTIMES T-Shirt 
• Ein gemeinsames Essen (geht auf mich), jederzeit in Hamburg

--------------------------------------------------

• 3 DIAMONDTIMES II books + both eBooks
• Mentioned in the book +
• A limited (1 of 10) 80x60cm print of choice, galery quality on Kodak Pro Endura!
• A personal postcard from the USA trip.
• A DIAMONDTIMES-Shirt
• A dinner (on me) whenever your in Hamburg, Germany

Am liebsten wäre mir ein Produktionszeitraum von Juni-September, Editing im Oktober, Druck im November und im Dezember liegen wir uns alle betrunken mit dem Buch in den Armen.Notfalls kann ich erst Ende August anfangen. Aber dann muss ich alles ein bisschen verdichten, mir mehr Mitarbeiter dazu holen und mache trotzdem im November den Sack zu. Dieses Buch wird zu 95% im Dezember fertig sein – zu 5% im Januar.Als zweites Risiko sehe ich den Buchtitel. Es muss in meiner Hand bleiben, das Buch umzubenennen. Falls ich mit einem alten Indianer in einem Tipi sitze und auf Kakteen-Sud plötzlich eine Epiphanie habe, dass das Ding anders heißen muss, muss ich das tun! Habt Verständnis.
Sorry, ich lebe im real existierenden Sozialismus und habe gar kein Geld ODER eigentlich mag ich keine Fotos, keine halbnackten Frauen, keine Palmen und schon gar keine Bücher.Kein Thema – wir wäre es, wenn du einem Bruder aushilfst und diese crowdfunding Kampagne teilst?! Bei Facebook oder whatever. Wäre super. Und ich würde dich dafür lieben. Und du kannst ganz toll die Tools nutzen, die IndieGoGo dafür bereit gestellt hat. Kinderleicht. DANKE für JEDE Hilfe! <3_____________________________________________________________________________:::: ENGLISH VERSION :::What‘s it about?In a nutshell and without BlaBla:The follow-up to my book DIAMONDTIMES should be bigger, better and cooler than ever. And for this I need your help – by pre-ordering, wanting this to happen and looking forward to beautiful extras and perks that I am willing bringing to you pretty people. So: for everyone who wants to get his hands on TALES OF AN AMERICAN SUMMER – it‘s only gonna happen here and through this. Ready for some rock‘n‘roll?You can reach me day and night: mail@benbernschneider.com and ask whatever you want to know. I will post videos and informations on a daily basis about how everything with this campaign is rolling uand I will spread a whole lotta love.An now with some background:My name is Ben Bernschneider, I am a photographer from Hamburg, Germany (www.benbernschneider.com) and I have released a book called DIAMONDTIMES in 2014. This little sucker – lucky me – was ripped from my hands in a few days time. For that I love every single on of you dearly. Obviously it is important to me that I really deliver with the follow-up.And for that I need people who are willing to be a part of this adventure and can‘t wait to order this thing.My photography was titled from "..." over "sparkling gritty" to "softporno analogo". For me it is a eclectic mix of coming-of-age-, college-, high-school-, 80s movies and a pretty handful of teen-savoir-vivre-lifestyle. It might sound shitty but results in pretty analog pictures that truly touch my heart. C-Heads found some beautiful words for DIAMONDTIMES: Interview.Here some much liked examples from DIAMONDTIMES:I‘m in! How are we pulling this off?As a little safety net I will need: 7.000 Euros.Well, at the end I will be needing MUCH more than this 7.000 Euros that are called for. I‘ll have to pay  taxes and Paypal and IndieGoGo also will want their share.But it would be a little basis for the printing costs. To cover the developing-, scanning-, printing-, production-, travel-, model- and styling expenses I will have to start paying it out of my own pocket for the beginning, but the most important step to getting it done in 2015 is the sum of 7k.I would do it in following steps:
with 7.000 € I would – just like DIAMONDTIMES – produce the thing in the size of 5,83" x 8,27" (DIN A 5). But with more than 180 pages. 
with 9.000 € we will swap to 8,27" x 11,69" (DIN A 4), but change it from HARDCOVER to SOFTCOVER and raise the pages up to 324.
reaching 11.000 € we will return to Hardcover AND 8,27" x 11,69" (DIN A 4) and lower the pages to 244.
with everything above that I will be raising the paper weight to the max. Yes!
IMPORTANT: shouldn‘t we reach the goal of 7.000 € everybody will automatically get their money back. Guaranteed. I will be very sad.(Of course I won‘t be sad at all. Life‘s a game. So no remorse!)Sounds f*#+% awesome! Where’s the catch? Risks?No sugarcoating here – I am doing this book. Even if I am bitten half to death by a coyote, I AM PRODUCING THIS. The only risk is the release date.I would love to produce it from June to September, editing in October, printing in November and when December arrives we are all drunk lying in each others arms with the book in our hands.Worst case I will start the main work end of August. But even then I will get myself some more manpower and get it done by November. So this book will to 95% appear in December – and to 5% in January 2016. As a second risk I see the book title. It must stay in my will and power to name that book whatever I want it to be. If I find myself sitting in an Tipi with an old Indian tripping on strange ancient drugs having an epiphany that I should name the book something else – I will have to do it so. I hope for your understanding.Dude, I am a mormon and I don‘t give a crap about money OR I hate pictures, books, half naked girls and palm trees.Chill, Mate – how about supporting a brother by sharing this little campaign?! On Facebook or whatever. That would be awesome!!! And I would love you for that! Oh, and you can use the tools that indieGoGo prepared for sharing. Easy peasy. THANKS for EVERY little help! <3::::::::::::::::: THE PERKS :::::::::::::::::::The tiny package
• Eine eBook-Version von DIAMONDTIMES (2014)• Ein dickes DANKESCHÖN dafür, dass du Begeisterung zeigst und hier mitmachst!
--------------------------------------------------
• A luxurious eBook version of DIAMONDTIMES (2014)• A huge THANK YOU for opening your heart and being a part of this!

the eBook package

• Eine eBook-Version von DIAMONDTIMES II (2015)• Eine eBook-Version von DIAMONDTIMES (2014) • Ein dickes DANKESCHÖN, dass du Herz zeigst und hier mitmachst!
--------------------------------------------------
• 1 eBook version of DIAMONDTIMES II (2015)• 1 eBook version of DIAMONDTIMES (2014) • A huge THANK YOU for opening your heart and being a part of this!

The book package

• Ein gedrucktes Exemplar von DIAMONDTIMES II!!! • Eine eBook-Version von DIAMONDTIMES II (2015)• Eine eBook-Version von DIAMONDTIMES (2014)• Eine persönliche Postkarte von der USA-Tour• Ein riesiges DANKESCHÖN noch obendrauf!
--------------------------------------------------
• A beautiful printed DIAMONDTIMES II book!!! • 1 eBook version of DIAMONDTIMES II (2015)• 1 eBook version of DIAMONDTIMES (2014)• A personal postcard from the trip• A gigantic THANK YOU on top!

The big package

• Ein signiertes, gedrucktes Exemplar von DIAMONDTIMES II • Du wirst namentlich im Buch erwähnt• 2 eBook-Versionen: DIAMONDTIMES II (2015) und DIAMONDTIMES (2014)• Eine persönliche Postkarte aus den USA• Ein DIAMONDTIMES T-Shirt• Ein riesiges DANKESCHÖN noch obendrauf!
--------------------------------------------------
• A beautiful signed DIAMONDTIMES II book• Your name mentioned in the book• 2 eBook versions: DIAMONDTIMES II (2015) and DIAMONDTIMES (2014)• A personal postcard from the USA trip.• A DIAMONDTIMES T-Shirt• A gigantic THANK YOU on top!

The huge package

• Zwei gedruckte Exemplare von DIAMONDTIMES II + beide eBook-Versionen • Namentliche Erwähnung im Buch• Eine persönliche Postkarte aus den USA• Ein DIAMONDTIMES T-Shirt• Ein paar gemeinsame Biere (gehen auf mich), jederzeit in Hamburg
--------------------------------------------------
• 2 beautiful printed DIAMONDTIMES II books + both eBooks• Your name mentioned in the book• A personal postcard from the USA trip.• A DIAMONDTIMES-Shirt• A few beers (on me) whenever your in Hamburg, Germany

The mega package
• 3 Exemplare von DIAMONDTIMES II + beide eBooks• Erwähnung im Buch + 60x40cm print NACH WAHL!• Eine persönliche Postkarte aus den USA• Ein DIAMONDTIMES T-Shirt • Ein gemeinsames Essen (geht auf mich), jederzeit in Hamburg

The sky is the limit package

story:
Update: Campaign Goal SMASHED


Firstly we would like to thank everybody who has donated to this campaign so far. Whilst this is an impressive milestone, there is still more reason to donate. 

Once Scott returns from the tour his next hurdle is the $2,000 debt for the accommodation. As it stands, he will be 'pushing himself to the limit' to repay this generous loan from the Academy. The deadline is 21st December (Right before Christmas), only leaving 3 months to pay back his outstanding debt.

Initially we thought it to be a far-fetched dream to achieve an end goal of $1,500. Scott (as you can tell from the video above) is completely overwhelmed with the generosity of backers thus far. He is also relieved that he need not endure the torture of 2 min noodles for 2 weeks.

As a person who is very passionate about puns, Scott is under the impression that the "$30 Pun-a-day Subscription" reward is the most valuable of all perks. If he reaches $2,500 he will extend the subscription to 2 months of original puns. This is gives you double the value so please donate today!

Thank you again for your donations, thank you for sharing the campaign and thank you for spreading his message.

Help define Scott's future. 

Scott Nenadovich is a full time student at the Academy of Design in Melbourne, Australia. Midway through his second year of a creative advertising degree, he was selected for an international study tour scholarship, but he doesn't have the means to take advantage of the opportunity. He was chosen based on his academic merit, large amount of volunteer work and having a motivated, positive personality. 

The trip involves spending two weeks in London and Paris absorbing the abundant design, art and culture.

Unfortunately for Scott, he is stuck with a debt of almost $2,000 worth of accommodation. In addition, he'll need to pay for gallery entry, design event tickets, food and the other expenses while in Europe in order to take advantage of this great opportunity.

What a design student like Scott can give back.

Break it down for folks in more detail:

$1500 won't cover everything, but it's a realistic goal that will allow Scott to manage the excesses (such as his accommodation loan) without having to eat 2min noodles every night.  

There are a number of great perks, from $1 to $150. All perks include lower value rewards , so a donation of $150 will get you all perks listed.

  • Pledge $5 or more and get a Facebook 'like' on your next status
  • Pledge $10 or more and Scott will send you a genuine compliment and thank you post
  • Pledge $30 or more and you'll get a pun a day for a month (texted to your mobile)
  • Pledge $50 or more and you'll get you a poorly written post card (due to broken hand) delivered to your mail box 
  • Pledge $100 or more and receive 3 hours of design work 
  • Pledge $150 or more and get an additional 3 hours of design work (keep in mind this equals a total of 6 hours toward a design of your choice - this could be a business card, logo, brochure, video content, illustration or shirt design)
There is no chance that your contribution will be wasted if Scott doesn't reach his goal. The airfares are covered by the Academy, so it just means he'll be missing out on some great opportunities if he's skint, but he'll be there making the most of his means (eating 2 min noodles). 

Give a young person the opportunity of a lifetime.

For Scott, this is well earned, a once in a lifetime opportunity. Never again will he have the chance to be travelling across the globe with nine of the Academy's brightest students who specialise in a variety of design and art fields. The students will travel with two of the most esteemed design professionals and tutors who work at the Academy, Derrek Shaw and Carlo Pagoda. 

Risks & Challenges

Whilst the tone of the promotional video is comedic based, Scott has really had to humble himself and bring to public light the fact that he does need help. Don't let Scott make a toss of himself. 

Desperate times call for desperate measures, but you can help ease his burden. 

Other Ways You Can Help

As a person who is reaching out for support, Scott understands that not everyone will be able to afford to support him. There are still many ways in which you can help his cause.

  • If his promotional video gave you a laugh please share the video to your friends and family, who knows how far reaching the campaign could go.
  • If you really want to help Scott, if you are able maybe ask a parent to help you chip in (I know you would love to receive a pun a day)

story:
What does it take to change a life for the better?

That is the question I am passionate to learn more about.

First, because I wanted to change my own life. Second, because I enjoy helping other people to do the same.


Who am I?

I am Lukas, 27 years old, originally from Germany and living in Amsterdam. I have studied psychology for 5 years and learned intensively about Nonviolent Communication (NVC) the past 3 years. After doing a course in Empathic Coaching last year, I started to help people to create change through 1on1 coaching.

(to learn more about my personal story watch the short video that I recorded above)


Why this campaign?

I now decided to join a 9 months program called "Coaching for Transformation" to deepen my skills and understanding of how to help people make meaningful changes in their life. Through this program I will become a professional certified coach.


To give you an idea why I am so excited about this program, here is a description about the program:

"As a coach, you can create bold relationships with clients to help them discover who they are, what they want to create, and how to manifest their vision and goals.

Coaching for Transformation (CFT) certified coaches use evolutionary processes to deepen awareness of the body, mind and spirit. By opening clients to their inner wisdom and creativity, they become empowered to be the change they want to see in the world.

[...] This 9-month programme is for experienced Nonviolent Communication practitioners who want to support personal and social change using deep, transformative practices."

If you want to know more about the details of the program, you can learn more here.
Or you can watch the second video above in the gallery.


And for this I need your help!

The costs for the program are $7,495 USD plus the accomodation for 12 days of the in person training (580€). I managed to get a scholarship which reduces the price of the program to $4,495 USD (=4104€). Furthermore as part of the training it is required to work with a professional coach for at least 6 hours (=600€).

As I have been studying for the past 5 years with an income of less than 4000€ per year, I am asking for your support to be able to pay for it.


The money I receive, I will invest in the following way:

Tuition fee for the 9 months coaching program = 4104€
6 hours of working with a professional coach = 600€
Accomodation and Meals for 3x 4 days of retreat = 580€

Total = 5284 €


For 30€ or more you have the opportunity to get a personal coaching experience with me. So you are able to invest in me and at the same time invest in yourself!


I am already thankful you invested your time time to read about this and I am even more looking forward to maybe be able to help you personally if you choose to support me.


With gratitude and love,

Lukas

story:
Developing Future Leaders in Indonesia

Could you make a difference with $5? The Indonesian Leadership Foundation (ILF) focuses on developing future leaders in Indonesia through education and professional development to make an impact in their community.

We invite you to contribute $5 to help us provide scholarship funds to underprivileged students in Indonesia.

What We Need

A $5 donation per person does not sound like much, but through this crowdfunding effort we are seeking to raise $4,000 (800 contributors) to be able to provide scholarships for 2 students in Indonesia for the whole year. Each student requires about $1,000 per semester. 

You can also give more to allow us to reach our goal sooner! Or become a regular contributor to our scholarship fund which would be of tremendous help to sustain our scholarship fund.

The Impact 

Have you looked back on your life to see how your education impacted you personally, or to people around you? Education changes a person and a community. ILF believes that to change a community, it takes one person at a time and education is the best way to leverage the change.

If you are grateful for the impact of education on you and see the positive impact it has made to people’s lives, pass it forward and make a change by giving others the opportunity to grow and make a difference.

Prior to 2015, ILF gave 6 scholarships to teachers who completed their Master’s degrees. They are teaching with much more confidence in Bogor, Salatiga, Poso, Nabire, and Jakarta. They are people with great vision who dedicate themselves to others, and are making a difference through their profession, to the children and young adult alike.

In 2015 ILF has selected 2 students to complete their Bachelor’s degrees.  The first recipient is studying English literature which will lead to a career as an English teacher. The second recipient is in medical school, planning to become a doctor to complete her internship in rural areas. Both of them have leadership qualities and hearts that are willing to serve.

Please support these future leaders who will bring a great impact to the communities!  Your donation is tax deductible as ILF is  a  501 (c) (3) non-profit organization.

Other Ways You Can Help

ILF is a volunteer based non-profit organization, none of the Trustees and staff are paid. All are generously giving their time and skills to make things happen. If you want to be part of the ILF volunteers, please send an e-mail to contact@indonesianleadership.org.

Please share this crowdfunding campaign, post it on your favorite social media, and spread the words about this good effort. Together we are better. Thank you!
