story:
About Haiqal's Garden

Haiqal’s Garden is Morning Circle Media's FIRST bilingual children’s book, in Indonesian and English, that promotes green living and urban farming. Author Syarief Syaifulloh wants to inspire and educate children about the benefits of growing fresh foods from their own backyard.

Syarief says: When I was a child in Indonesia, I was surrounded by farm lands and mountain ranges. I woke up to the smell of horse manure and the fresh air of the countryside. I enjoyed my childhood and would never want to forget how I grew up. I want my children to have the outdoor experience I had when I was their age. They were born in the city, without the feel of the countryside. I didn’t think it was fair for them. I started to tweak city life and bring bits and pieces of my childhood into their life.

One of our goals is to support bilingual literacy. The book is translated into Indonesian by our friend Jeanny Kwa. Another goal is to show elements of Indonesian art and culture. The book is illustrated with traditional Indonesian batik designs by Donna Backues, an artist from Philadelphia. I am proud of my homeland and would like to share a piece of it with my children and children around the world. 

For a 12-month period, my wife and I, along with Morning Circle Media President Cynthia Kreilick, took photographs of Haiqal and myself prepping, planting, tending, and harvesting our backyard garden. It was a fun project and Haiqal was thoroughly entertained to be the main character of this book!

Funding

Our team would like to donate 300 copies of Haiqal's Garden for children in Philadelphia schools. It will also enable four author visits and four gardening events to low-income families in our surrounding area. We want to spread healthy lifestyles and teach kids and their families to be self-sufficient and good stewards of the Earth!

As a thank you for funding our project, we have given several perks so you can start encouraging your little ones and introduce them to gardening. You can start in your own backyard!

Community Impact

Your contribution is UNIQUE! You will be powering the first campaign to bring a children's gardening book to both Indonesian-speaking and English-speaking families all over the world. There are no other books like Haiqal's Garden!

The book's publisher, Morning Circle Media, prides itself on shining a big light on the contributions immigrants are making in the U.S.A. They have educated hundreds of children, teachers, and families about the languages and cultures that give color and richness to our cities and towns.

Risks & Challenges

Children's book publishing is a labor of love. As authors, we write and make beautiful illustrations because we believe in the transformative power of good literature. Printing books is expensive. Profit margins are small. Without your help, this will be  a steep mountain to climb for our team.

The quality of Morning Circle Media children's books and the unique subject matter have produced a loyal, enthusiastic following of schools, teachers, parents, and children. 

This campaign will help us distribute the financial burden so that, at the end of 60 days, we'll have what we need to make this one-of-a-kind book dream a reality!

Other Ways You Can Help

You can pre-order Haiqal's Garden here to share the book with your children, friends, and family members.
story_txt:
About Haiqal's GardenHaiqal’s Garden is Morning Circle Media's FIRST bilingual children’s book, in Indonesian and English, that promotes green living and urban farming. Author Syarief Syaifulloh wants to inspire and educate children about the benefits of growing fresh foods from their own backyard.Syarief says: When I was a child in Indonesia, I was surrounded by farm lands and mountain ranges. I woke up to the smell of horse manure and the fresh air of the countryside. I enjoyed my childhood and would never want to forget how I grew up. I want my children to have the outdoor experience I had when I was their age. They were born in the city, without the feel of the countryside. I didn’t think it was fair for them. I started to tweak city life and bring bits and pieces of my childhood into their life.One of our goals is to support bilingual literacy. The book is translated into Indonesian by our friend Jeanny Kwa. Another goal is to show elements of Indonesian art and culture. The book is illustrated with traditional Indonesian batik designs by Donna Backues, an artist from Philadelphia. I am proud of my homeland and would like to share a piece of it with my children and children around the world. For a 12-month period, my wife and I, along with Morning Circle Media President Cynthia Kreilick, took photographs of Haiqal and myself prepping, planting, tending, and harvesting our backyard garden. It was a fun project and Haiqal was thoroughly entertained to be the main character of this book!FundingOur team would like to donate 300 copies of Haiqal's Garden for children in Philadelphia schools. It will also enable four author visits and four gardening events to low-income families in our surrounding area. We want to spread healthy lifestyles and teach kids and their families to be self-sufficient and good stewards of the Earth!
As a thank you for funding our project, we have given several perks so you can start encouraging your little ones and introduce them to gardening. You can start in your own backyard!



Community Impact
Your contribution is UNIQUE! You will be powering the first campaign to bring a children's gardening book to both Indonesian-speaking and English-speaking families all over the world. There are no other books like Haiqal's Garden!
The book's publisher, Morning Circle Media, prides itself on shining a big light on the contributions immigrants are making in the U.S.A. They have educated hundreds of children, teachers, and families about the languages and cultures that give color and richness to our cities and towns.
Risks & Challenges
Children's book publishing is a labor of love. As authors, we write and make beautiful illustrations because we believe in the transformative power of good literature. Printing books is expensive. Profit margins are small. Without your help, this will be  a steep mountain to climb for our team.
The quality of Morning Circle Media children's books and the unique subject matter have produced a loyal, enthusiastic following of schools, teachers, parents, and children. 
This campaign will help us distribute the financial burden so that, at the end of 60 days, we'll have what we need to make this one-of-a-kind book dream a reality!
Other Ways You Can Help
You can pre-order Haiqal's Garden here to share the book with your children, friends, and family members.

story:
Sweet Tree Arts in Hope is entering its third year of community arts programming.
Families - In our first 3 years we have provided after school
programming for students ages 5 to 18, for over 300 families from near and far. We offer preschool classes in arts and science, a series of popular summer workshops and numerous adult workshops.  Over 1000 people in the Mid-coast region and beyond have directly enjoyed experiences at Sweet Tree Arts.

Community - Community interactions have included a wide array of musical gatherings, story telling events, the Hope Children’s festival and an open space as a resource for a variety of other interests.


Teachers - Sweet Tree Arts is a satellite location for Lesley University. We offer a Masters in Education integrating the arts across the curriculum. Committed graduate students from around the state completed the program this February and a new cohort group plans to begin soon. We have also offered a variety of free or low cost educational workshops to teachers state wide.


Adults with Special Needs - We offer a weekly program for adults with special needs through Coastal Opportunities in photography and drawing.



Sweetland school children play 'Black Mamba'
 Sweetland School

This fall we launched a community focused, Reggio inspired,  arts integrated elementary school.  Sweetland School has been recognized by the state of Maine as an independent school. We also have flexible creative arts options for registered home school students.


Goals - Our goal with the variety of programming we offer is to allow families at all stages and ages to engage and gather in a space dedicated to community and the arts. As a low profit, socially conscious L3C business, we work hard to create opportunities for our community.  As we grow, the request for tuition assistance is increasing.  We need specific scholarship support for this increasing need.


Community Engagement - Our mentors are committed to the arts and the community.  Our highly respected advisory board brings a wealth of experience from many corners of the world. Sweet Tree Arts has blossomed into a place of alternative education, community gatherings and innovative ideas.


Founder Lindsay Pinchbeck tells a story at annual 2015 Story Slam

We were recently honored by Down East in the Best of the Best for Best Community Enrichment and received a Youth Advocacy award from Five Towns Community that Care.  Sweet Tree Arts is now an integral piece of Hope and continues to garner attention state wide and within alternative education settings.

Hopes and Dreams - As we look forward and strengthen our current programs, we ask individuals and businesses to support our efforts to make the creative arts available to the families requesting financial assistance.  I have listed a variety of suggested ways you may support the efforts of Sweet Tree Arts/ Sweetland School and we are happy to offer a token of appreciation for your support.

$5-$10 - Seeds Free Summer Open studio pass.

$25 - $50  -  Leaves - Supporting individual – 1 printed card created from art work by Sweet Tree artist. 

$100- $150-  Branches - Friend of Sweet Tree Arts - 6 printed greeting cards created from art work by Sweet Tree artist. 

$250 – $500 -  Trunks - Event sponsor – Listed on website and on any advertising promotions around events, plus 2 free tickets to your sponsored event.

$500 + - Roots - Major sponsor – your logo or name featured on our website in the sponsorship section plus an original piece of art work created by a Sweet Tree artist. 

Sincerely

Lindsay Pinchbeck

Sweet Tree Arts / Sweetland School Director

1 Minute at Sweetland School:
Empathy, Kindness and Wonder - Arts Integration at Work.

story:
Speaking at the National Press Club on matters impacting poor communities and the need for financial literacy education.

Blackmon discusses financial literacy effort with White House Press Secretary Josh Earnest.


Receiving $20,000 small business grant form Industrial Bank CEO Doyle Mitchell.


Short Summary

My name is Imani Blackmon, I am currently a freshman finance major at Howard University in Washington DC. I am launching this crowdfunding campaign in an effort to help my generation understand the importance of financial and purchasing decisions; and how choices made early in life can have a negative effect on the future. My book, The Future Starts Today: A Young Person's Guide to Financial Independence was written specifically for this purpose. Throughout our nation, there are communities that have been termed "Unbanked" or "Underbanked" largely as a result of poor personal financial management choices. Your support of this campaign will allow me to provide 25,000 copies of my book to students in these communities at no cost to them. The book is closely aligned with the academic content standards of the Personal Financial Literacy Curriculum in most states and can be used as a supplement to the course syllabus.

What We Need & What You Get

The campaign is designed to raise $325,000 to cover the cost of the books, along with shipping and freight. All funds raised will be used for the purposes outlined. The individual cost per copy is $12.99. Donors can either purchase single copies to be donated to a student or school of their choice, or purchase a special "Classroom Set" of 30 books for $450 so that each student in the class will receive an individual copy. A personal letter will accompany the donation to the school or student in the name of the donor. 

The Impact

I believe that the long term impact of helping students in poor communities understand the real value of money and how to resist the urge of impulse purchases, will not only improve their buying power, but make them wiser consumers. They will also learn how to save and invest for the future. The ultimate impact upon their economies will be positive. Communities that have been termed "unbanked' will realize the benefits to their neighborhoods and the resultant quality of life can be improved. The book has been carefully aligned with the Learning Outcomes of most state curricular objectives in Personal Financial Literacy.

Risks & Challenges

I am a 1st year college student studying finance and I am concerned about the decisions that I see many of my friends make. These impulse decisions will have a negative impact upon their lives in the long run. I am a graduate of the Academy of Finance. Since beginning college last Fall, I have written a book on financial literacy, interned at fortune 500 firms such as KPMG and Morgan Stanley, I received my credentials as a financial planner with Transamerica, and have launched my own investment firm, Blackmon Holdings, LLC. I think that students are perhaps more prone to listen to a member of their generation. As an 18 year old university student, I believe that I have a unique perspective on the inclinations of the Millennial generation.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in a position to contribute to this campaign, I ask that you share this information with your social networks. There are specific share tools that you can use through Indiegogo.

story:
"I have come to set the earth on fire, and how I wish it were already blazing!" 

Who We Are

The LCI is a year long Catholic education and formation program designed to spread the mission of the new evangilization in the East and West. Pope John Paul II called the the church to "breath with her two lungs" [the East and the West]. Established after the fall of communism in 1992, the LCI is helping to rebuild the Church in countries where Goodness, Truth, and Beauty were repressed.
What our students receive:
  • A year of experience living in a Catholic community
  • A full immersion year long English program
  • Intensive study of theology and catechism 
  • Participation in formation and evanglization courses
  • Interaction and relationships with other young people with the same goals
  • Tools necessary to make a difference in their native countries

Why We Need You

What we do is only possible through the support, generosity, and prayers of people like you. All of our students are supported by scholarships which cover tuition costs and living expenses. Currently we are trying to expand our program to provide more young people the opportunity to study here. Every donation of any size makes a difference. Your donations go directly to the students and cover costs such as:

  • Tuition
  • Books
  • Food
  • Living Expenses

“There is no other school where I can receive such a well-rounded Catholic education, where the Faith is lived by the teachers and the students surrounding me. I will be able to take these experiences and this education to use as a foundation for living my Faith for the rest of my life.”

- Ayya Cholukova, Turkmenistan


Photo Credit- Martin Tomko

The Impact

We believe that in order to change a culture we must start on a personal level, by helping each human person encounter Christ. The LCI has over 450 graduates from 26 countries who are now living and working through out eastern Europe and Asia to build the Church in their communities. What we do is only a drop in the bucket compared to the lasting effects our graduates have on their communities. Our graduates work in various occupations such as teachers, lawyers, businessmen, youth ministers, doctors, English translators, priests, and religious. 

“Many of us came to Gaming from the secular world, having not much connection with the Church, not having Christian experience and knowledge, and returned to our homes renewed and with a clear vision of Christian life, plus the knowledge of English. I always tell my friends that the year I spent in Gaming was the best year of my life, and it’s true…God touched my soul in a very powerful way.”

- Lena Bogoyavlenskaya, Russia

Why Joy? Why Truth? 

The Joy of the Gospel the Freedom of Truth

We live in a world of confusion. A world that teaches consumerism over compassion and complacency over humility. We live among people searching for purpose and passion, turning to self-medication to dull the pain or the next self help book hoping to find some answers. This is not what we were made for. We were not made to exist, but to thrive. 

The joy of the gospel is a call out of ourselves and into a personal encounter with Jesus Christ. We were made for the Truth. By rejecting the lies of our cultures and living authentic Christian lives, we are freed from the bondage of sin and are able to truly live new life in Christ. 

"The joy of the gospel fills the hearts and lives of all who encounter Jesus. Those who accept his offer of salvation are set free from sin, sorrow, inner emptiness and loneliness. With Christ joy is constantly born anew. In this Exhortation I wish to encourage the Christian faithful to embark upon a new chapter of evangelization marked by this joy, while pointing out new paths for the Church’s journey in years to come."

- The Holy Father Francis 

  

For More Information

Visit us at www.lciaustria.org 
Read Evangelli Gaudium here http://tinyurl.com/pbw4kj7 



Promotional Video Credits:

Song: 107          Artist: Josh Garrels          Album: Lost Animals

Photo Credit- Kevin Heider

story:
Summary

Hello and greetings from Southern California. I am Dr. Moses Seenarine, teacher, author and publisher. Plant-based diets can stop climate chaos! And we are on a mission to prove this! 

Please join us in spreading the plant-based revolution to a healthier and greener future.

What We Need & What You Get

To promote the plant-based solution to climate change, we are launching a must-read, essential guidebook on the intersection of climate and diet - "Meat Climate Change: The 2nd Leading Cause of Global Warming." 

This book would be useful to anyone interested in learning about climate change, the environment, diet and health, social inequality, and animal-based agribusiness. 

We are reaching out to like minded individuals who can help us with the book launch. We are trying to raise $2,000 to pay for marketing, promotional materials, and a book tour in California. 

You get lots of perks for your generous contributions, from book recommendations and digital posters, to digital and printed copies of the book.

The Impact

Meat Climate Change is one of the most relevant books of our times, and a blueprint for human survival. Climate warming is a clear and present danger, and food is the second leading cause, next to fossil fuel. 

To slow the pace of global warming, it is vital to reduce fossil fuels, use renewable energy, and practice energy conservation. But this is not enough. Reducing animal consumption is critical, and this publication shows how to get us there.

The funds raised will be used to reach out to the general public, students, educators, social and environmental activists, climate scientists and policy-makers. We have three conferences scheduled so far and adding more talks, book signing, and other outreach events for the year.

Other Ways You Can Help

Here are several other ways you can help: 

Here are several other ways you can help: 

1. Buy this must-read book for someone who need to see the facts: http://tinyurl.com/jjedhcv

2. Share the book link with friends, colleagues and others who could benefit from this guidebook

3. Follow us and share the book link on social media:

 http://www.facebook.com/meatclimatechange/     @meatclimate     #meatclimate

4. Contribute to our launch crowdfunding campaign: http://igg.me/at/mcclaunch/x/163871

5. Write a review on Amazon: http://tinyurl.com/jjedhcv

6. Write a book review for press, blog, or newsletter (contact us for review copy)

7. Suggest this guidebook to schools, libraries, organizations and/or institutes

8. Suggest this guidebook as background reading for a class or training

9. Share this guidebook with bureaucrats, lobbyists, and political representatives

10. Suggest the author to events and groups that may be interested

11. Send us your comments and suggestions for improvements and networking

Thanks for your time and consideration

story:
TRISH MCCARTY - Founder of StarShine Academy

StarShine Academy

Is a K-12 Charter School recognized as an innovator in education. We believe every child is born for responsibility and abundance, once they learn how to attain it and sustain it. We are dedicated to revamping education and shaping our teaching techniques, so that each student is given the best opportunity to learn.  
At StarShine, self-empowerment, an appreciation for finer things, along with self-discipline are deemed essential to success. In recognition of our efforts StarShine has been nationally and internationally accredited, honored by the United Nations as a School for Peace. StarShine has also recently accepted to participate in the XPrize Global Learning Challenge to eradicate global illiteracy as well as working with The Pope in order to implement StarShine's curriculum in the Boys' and Girls' Towns. 


Be a Part of the Change

Many of our StarShine students cannot afford the basic necessities required to effectively and actively be a part of the learning environment.  Due to a variety of circumstances, students are forced either suffer through the day with ill fitting shoes making each day more painful than the last.  They wear tattered clothing, making them self conscience and subject to ridicule.  Others lack basic school supplies, such as pencils and paper.  All of these things distract students from reaching their full potential and excelling in class.  With the funds raised, we will help provide new shoes, school uniforms, backpacks filled with supplies, along with other education tools, all in an effort to help each student be the best they can be!   

Your donation will directly help StarShine Academy and its students pursue improvements to the K-12 experience by imagining, supporting and advancing solutions to today's greatest challenges.


  • $150 gift will go towards the purchase of three (3) backpacks filled with supplies. 
Each NEW backpack may have the pencils - protractors & geometry rulers - loose leaf lined paper - pencil cases - binders - notebooks - glue sticks - straight rulers - pencil sharpeners - washable markers - folders - thumb drives - erasers. ( Items will be determined based on each students curriculum)
  • $300 gift will go towards the purchase of 10 pairs of athletic shoes.
  • $500 gift will go towards the purchase of 10 uniforms.
  • $1500 gift will provide 10 students with the total academic package - backpack, supplies, uniform and a pair of athletic shoes.
*For all $1500 gifts, donors will receive a leaf on StarShine Academy's Giving Tree*

Stars for StarShine is trying to raise $3,000 to outfit 20 students who are desperately in need of backpacks, school supplies, uniforms and shoes for this coming school year.  Although our goal is low, StarShine currently has 300 students enrolled for the 2015-2016 school year, many of who would greatly benefit from many of these items as well.  Please do not be discouraged to give beyond our goal as the additional funds raised will go towards supporting more students in need.

Spread The Word and Love

We appreciate you spreading the word about our campaign to help StarShine in order to change our future and world!! Send to your friends, family, and colleagues so we can all be a part of change in our community! We are grateful for all the help you can give!  

The Impact

By becoming a Star for StarShine, you will help StarShine Academy pursue improvements to the K - 12 experience by imagining, supporting and advancing solutions to today's greatest challenges. 

Stars for StarShine's mission is to inspire and empower the community to become visionary donors in support of StarShine Academy, a place that transcends traditional boundaries and cultivates brighter futures for our youth. 

Stars for StarShine will offer you an opportunity to find and explore your philanthropic passion for K-12 education and our community.

StarShine Accepts XPRIZE Challenge

StarShine Planet’s XPRIZE project, known as the Global Learning Environment & Experience, or GLEE for short, is in full swing. StarShine is one of 188 teams competing and collaborating to achieve the XPRIZE goals.

To remind you, the long-term goal of the Global Learning XPRIZE is to end illiteracy, world-wide.  As a step towards that goal, the XPRIZE organization created a $15M purse to stimulate and reward the development of the tablet-based software tool that best improves student performance in reading, writing, and math over the course of an 18-month field test in sub-Saharan Africa.  The target population is children 7 to 10 years old, and the field tests will be conducted by five finalist teams, with each team being assigned approximately 600 students.  The finalists will be selected by judges on the basis of learning potential, design quality, and implementation quality.  The XPRIZE winner will be selected based on student performance improvement, weighted 60% to reading, 10% to writing, and 30% to math.

At the same time, a GLEE design team of ten dedicated individuals has been stepping through a structured design process led by Jack Ring. Jack is a Fellow of the International Council on Systems Engineering with decades of experience designing, implementing, and radically improving systems ranging from satellite launch systems and e-commerce to high-performance automobile racing engines.  Under his guidance, the team went through a brainstorming process to identify desired and undesired outcomes of the project across a comprehensive set of stakeholders, and then prioritized the outcomes to determine the top 27 effects we envision our system contributing to its users and other stakeholders. Following that, we began accumulating a collection of system “vignettes”, illustrating how we think the system we develop will be used by young students day by day.  These vignettes will illustrate how the students initially become familiar and competent with using the tablet hardware and software, and what the students will see as they progress through a tablet-based curriculum focused reading, writing, arithmetic—and StarShine. Meanwhile we are vigorously recruiting sources of excellent ideas and tools that expedite the pace and scope of learning, and sources of information technology and systems for hosting these assets on the Android platform. We will have much more to say about that soon.

XPRIZE TEAM

 For more information on StarShine’s participation with The XPRIZE, visit starshineplanet.com/

Trish Meets the Pope!

Pope to utilize Phoenix school's curriculum in church's global orphanages

PHOENIX (KPHO/KTVK) -

Pope Francis wants to put the curriculum from her Phoenix charter school, StarShine Academy, in his orphanages around the world.

"You learn how to take care of yourself, how to take care of the things around you," Trish McCarty said.

Skyping from Rome, the charter school's founder explains how she was invited to meet Pope Francis.

"This man has an aura and a gentleness that most people describe and you could feel it," she said. "In fact, I've been so emotional all week."

McCarty also sat down with Vatican leaders because the pope wants to utilize her peace-based curriculum in the church's global orphanages called Boys' & Girls' Towns. They visited one in Italy.


"My philosophy was that when you teach people how to have a loving, safe, kind environment, they start doing that themselves," McCarty said.

"Kids need our help," she said. "They don't feel loved, they don't feel safe and they don't feel like they have a future, and they do. They're our future."

McCarty said their methods have proven to work in Phoenix where their kids are often below the poverty line.

"The first place that we opened was on the worst drive-by shooting street in Phoenix and within months the crime stopped," she said.

She returns Monday with rosaries given by the pope and although not Catholic, she now feels a divine inspiration to spread what they started in the Valley to the rest of the world.

"I just think that we got a big wind beneath our wings to say that we're all in this together," she said.

McCarty said their next step is to translate their curriculum into Italian so the Vatican can start implementing it first in their Boys' & Girls' Towns in Italy.

Copyright 2015 KPHO/KTVK (KPHO Broadcasting Corporation). All rights reserved.

What's Happening at StarShine

WELCOME...HILLCREST HOOPS!  

This is a comprehensive high school and post-graduate basketball program, which includes personalized strength and speed training for each player, ongoing basketball-skills development, on-campus housing and an extensive season of games, tournaments and showcases.  Their goal is to have the players seen by as many college coaches and recruiters as possible; they'll be bringing 50-100 coaches to StarShine this year!  We're thrilled to have these exceptional young men living and training with us for the next year!  Come see how great they are!

Summer Creative Camp  

"PROJECT CREO"  (projectcreo.com)  is an international network of kids empowered to change the world through creativity and love.  They'll be here at StarShine in July to offer their talents for up to 45 kids, from 8 to 18.  This is open to all children, not just current students.

TRISH MCCARTY - Founder of StarShine Academy
StarShine Academy

Is a K-12 Charter
School recognized as an innovator in education. We believe every child is born
for responsibility and abundance, once they learn how to attain it and sustain
it. We are dedicated to revamping education and shaping our teaching
techniques, so that each student is given the best opportunity to learn.
 At StarShine, self-empowerment, an appreciation for finer things, along
with self-discipline are deemed essential to success. In recognition of our
efforts StarShine has been nationally and internationally accredited, honored
by the United Nations as a School for Peace. StarShine has also recently
accepted to participate in the XPrize Global Learning Challenge to eradicate
global illiteracy as well as working with The Pope in order to implement
StarShine's curriculum in the Boys' and Girls' Towns. 

  Be a Part of the Change



Many of our StarShine students cannot afford the basic
necessities required to effectively and actively be a part of the learning
environment.  Due to a variety of circumstances,
students are forced either suffer through the day with ill fitting shoes making
each day more painful than the last. 
They wear tattered clothing, making them self conscience and subject to
ridicule.  Others lack basic school
supplies, such as pencils and paper.  All
of these things distract students from reaching their full potential and
excelling in class.  With the funds
raised, we will help provide new shoes, school uniforms, backpacks filled with
supplies, along with other education tools, all in an effort to help each
student be the best they can be!   
Your
donation will directly help StarShine Academy and its students pursue
improvements to the K-12 experience by imagining, supporting and advancing
solutions to today's greatest challenges.


  $150 gift will go towards the purchase of three (3) backpacks filled with supplies. 


Each NEW backpack may have the pencils - protractors & geometry rulers - loose leaf lined paper - pencil cases - binders - notebooks - glue sticks - straight rulers - pencil sharpeners - washable markers - folders - thumb drives - erasers. ( Items will be determined based on each students curriculum)

 $300 gift will go towards the purchase of 10 pairs of athletic shoes.


$500 gift will go towards the purchase of 10 uniforms.
$1500 gift will provide 10 students with the total academic package - backpack, supplies, uniform and a pair of athletic shoes.

story:
This is my beautiful daughter, Erica (on the right). She is 13 years old.

She is outgoing and talkative and extremely creative!

She has NF1 Neurofibromatosis. She was diagnosed as a baby of just 9 months. She has brain tumors and she has tumors going down her spine and all over her body. Pretty much wherever there is nerve, she can get a fibrous tumor. She also has a tumor growing on her optic nerve and she also has been diagnosed with optic atrophy (the nerves are deteriorating in her right eye). She is starting to lose the peripheral and central vision in her right eye. She never lets this condition get her down though. She tries so hard to push past the pain and discomfort with a smile and a laugh.

Erica has severe Learning Disabilities and Behaviour and attachment issues. She is in a special education program at her school and we do get respite, but this is not enough sadly.

This past couple of years Erica has been bullied at school and suffering from low self esteem and self-worth. Honestly, she has been a challenge to handle this past couple of years. It is very disappointing to admit but her and I have severe detachment issues. She has some behaviour issues, more than most teenagers. (yelling, constant lying to us and to people at school, constant talking back, she is also unable to regulate her mood)

There is an amazing theraputic camp that she would benefit from. This place is called Venture Academy and it is in Kelowna, BC. This place actually deals with teenagers who have attachment issues. I have tried to get her into a camp close to home but they have all told me she is too learning diabled and behaviorally challenged to qualify attending other camps.

This camp would benefit her greatly! They do full Psycho-Educational and full Psychological assessments and she would have access to intense therapy daily and school help.(Erica is currently in Grade 7 but has a gr 3 reading level and gr 2 math level) We need to know how she ticks. How she can communicate her needs in a better way (instead of yelling, screaming, threatening, lying). They will teach her how to be an overall better person in all aspects of her life. The program will be a life changer for everyone who is in Erica's life, including her 4 younger siblings.

This Camp is a lot of money for us as a family to afford but I know it is the best thing for my child. All a mother wants for her daughter is to be a strong and confident person ready to take on the world. I am just at a loss as to do what I can at home to help her. It is my wish and prayer that she gets the help that I cannot give her. I need our relationship to be strong as she travels through being a teenager and into adulthood.

I know this is a very vulnerable side of me that is being expressed here and I just want you all to think about that while you read this. I am not a 'bad' mom. It is not about me as a mom, this is about Erica. I am willing to do whatever it takes to help her (including pouring my heart out here).

Thank you Thank you! This means the WORLD to us and to Erica !

story:
Situation

 

I came to China in January 2012 to practice Kung Fu in a chinese Martial Arts Academy. After three months training with different Masters I finally found an amazing, caring and unique martial artist as a master: Master Wang.

Having grown up in a poor environment and without a father, which in China means you're worth nothing, he always had to work hard to achieve respect.This made him focus on his training from a young age and pushed him to keep going! He became a chinese Sanda Champion. After a sport accident, where he suffered a serious back injury, he couldn't follow his fighting career anymore. That's when he started to teach foreigners. For ten years he worked every day, trained people non-stop and to be able to communicate even better with his students, he learned basic English.

This year he finally managed to found his own Kung Fu school in Henan, Deng Feng, where he could train and teach, independent from any other authority, the way he always wanted. He created and environment according to his own rules and beliefs, and during the time at the academy it would not be uncommon for students to refer to themselves as brothers and sisters, because he made us feel like we all belong together.

However, because of misplaced trust in people who provided him with the wrong paperwork he started having problems with the local authorities, which are now forcing him to shut down his school. This not only means that he can't do what he loves the most, teaching, but also it means that after ten years of hard work there is nothing left for him and he has to start all over again.

By raising any amount of money, we could support this man to make his dream come true once again and to open his own Kung Fu school in a more promising part of China.

 

 

What's necessary

 

The more money we could raise, the better. If we were able to reach our goal of raising 15'000 Dollars, we would be able to pay for a whole new school for Master Wang, but even a small fund would be extremly helpful to his cause and would bring us one step closer to make sure that he can continue doing what he loves.

In comparison to the western world, the cost of living in China is generally lower, so even a small amount of money goes a long way.

Donations collected on this page will be sent to Master Wang's long-term student Aleksandar Ljustina who currently resides with him.

 

 

The Impact

 

During my Travels in China I realized how privileged western countries are, compared to China. If one has money in China, everything will work out for him, if one is poor, he will not get any help from anyone.

To raise funds for this man, means to give someone an opportunity, that he will probably never have again without our help.

His passion is teaching,. He puts all his heart and effort in all of his students! Everybody who trained under Master Wang knows, what a kind, focused and unbelievably caring person he is! I personally trained under many different Masters, but Shifu Wang is the only one who builds a personal relationship with you within a short time and makes you feel like part of his family and therefore stands out as a unique personality!

It is our personal wish, as students of Master Wang, to make sure that he can continue his amazing work and to give others the lucky chance to experience what we did.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

If you want to help, but can't spare the money right now, please share this link on any social networking platform. The more people that know about the situation, the better.

story:
What We Need & What You Get

In order to go on this trip I need $3,500. This money will go into the payment of the traveling agency in which my school has a contract. This money will also be used to have meals while in Japan when I am no longer with my host family and we move to a hotel in Tokyo Japan.

For every donation made that is over $25 I will personally create an origami figure and send it to the donator with all my thanks. 

The Impact

I was chosen to take part in this trip by my Japanese class teacher because of my willingness to participate and eagerness to achieve the highest possible standard presented to me with the opportunities I am given. Being from the less wealthy neighborhood of bush in South Chicago I want to take full advantage of the opportunities given to me because I am aware of how scarce they are because of my low income family and Hispanic racial background. So, if you don’t mind, please help by donating as much as you please, I will be truly grateful. Thank you all very much. 

Learning about things around the world will help me help others in the future by being able to see problems in every prospective possible thus, being able to see all solutions possible. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate, Thanks for the thought! You can help me by telling people about my cause and spreading the word via all social networks if you please.

story:
My name is Jessica. I am a mother of two girls. My children attend a Christian Montessori program . I am raising money to help build raised garden beds , bin composter, and coop to add to their curriculum at school. I will used to the garden beds to help grow vegetables and some fruits for the families at the school.

The curriculum will include soil microorganism, worm composting, bin composting and life cycle. Soil microorganisms are very important part of gardening. I will focus on teaching the soil food web and mycorrhizal fungi. This fungi forms around the plant roots. It receives energy from the plant and supply the plant with nutrients. I will purchasing three different types of earthworms to use for composting. The children will be taught the life cycle of the earthworms. The goals is to teach reducing waste while reducing our carbon foot print. The worming casting with then be used as soil amendment. Worm casting are a great fertilizer. It improves soil structure, increases microorganism and improves water holding capacity. Castings enhances germination, plant growth and crop yields. I will also have a compost bin to compost lawn and tree waste. The ages compost will be add to the garden. I will build a chicken coop with a run to house for four hens. The chickens will be used for teaching life cycle and egg laying. The eggs will be distributed to the families and teachers. The chickens will be allowed in the garden for a few hours each day to assist in removing bugs and weeding. I will use the earthworms as a treat for the chickens. The chicken manure will be add to the compost bin for later use as compost.

Your contribution will assist young children to appreciate plant earth and help save our planet. It is important for urban children to learn to importance of conservation and recycling. Some may never learn without the assists of school. Your contribution will make a huge difference! I thank you for your help.

I will purchasing three different types of earthworms to use for composting. The children will be taught the life cycle of the earthworms. The goals is to teach reducing waste while reducing our carbon foot print. The worming casting with then be used as soil amendment. Worm casting are a great fertilizer. It improves soil structure, increases microorganism and improves water holding capacity. Castings enhances germination, plant growth and crop yields. I will also have a compost bin to compost lawn and tree waste. The ages compost will be add to the garden. I will build a chicken coop with a run to house for four hens. The chickens will be used for teaching life cycle and egg laying. The eggs will be distributed to the families and teachers. The chickens will be allowed in the garden for a few hours each day to assist in removing bugs and weeding. I will use the earthworms as a treat for the chickens. The chicken manure will be add to the compost bin for later use as compost.
Your contribution will assist young children to appreciate plant earth and help save our planet. It is important for urban children to learn to importance of conservation and recycling. Some may never learn without the assists of school. Your contribution will make a huge difference! I thank you for your help.

story:
Kameron the Bold

In the debates you hear about the middle class and about the best students getting the college degree they need for the future.  What about the real back bone of America?  Basic protection and security in time of emergency!   That's for heros right?  I'm a hero in training.  Or at least with your help I will be. 

On the advice of my hero mentors I've gone out on a limb here.  I borrowed the money for tuition, books and gear to become a front line fire fighter.  Big price tag. I know.  This is just the price of this semester's books, the turnouts and two sets of dress outs that I can guarantee you are washed and ironed on an ongoing basis.  I'm so swamped with studies and push ups that I forgot about the cash flow aspect.

I know times are tough and please don't invest if you don't have the means, but if you do please know that I am the future.   I have this calling to combine my mother's compassion and father's fearless energy to do what is right. 

I have already been working very hard and as a result will be certified for CPR in just weeks.  I know that it is alot of money, but if I can save just one life, it is everything.

Family, friends, neighbors, community, countrymen, I ask that you do what you can and promise in return I will remain, the man that wants to go in when it is too steep, too volitile, too hot. I'm just crazy that way so you don't have to be. Peace out.

story:
Our Story

Hello!  I’m Stephanie, a recently retired public school teacher volunteering in Ecuador’s Amazon basin at Yachana High School. I am one of five teachers teaching both mestizo and indigenous students representing four distinct indigenous communities, Kichwa, Shuar, Huaorani, and Shiviar. This year, I have three groups of ten students each, rotating in and out of external internships and the high school every three weeks in an unprecedented gap year providing practical  hands-on education. We want to document  the students' activities this year through digital photography when they are participating in their internships.  We also have many activities going on at the high school.  In conjunction with the yearbook, students are also excited about designing and developing a digital pen pal program with American students where they would share pictures of where they sleep, eat, play, and study.  The photos will include short explanations in either Spanish or English. But we need cameras.  Even though the school experiences sporadic electricity and intermittent Internet, we have the means to put the yearbook together.  Our satellite connection will allow us to regularly maintain a pen pal digital exchange to help practice our English and to form relationships with students from other parts of the world.


The Impact

Kids, for the first time in the Amazonian basin, will be able to share ideas, cultures, traditions with their American digital pen pals. We will also be able to document the activities throughout the year which will be turned into a yearbook by the students.  Our personal goals at the school support sustainability and conservation, both concepts their American pen pals would also benefit from learning. The future of the world depends on what we teach our children and putting a personal face on it makes our shrinking world more real and more available to both cultures.


We are an NGO.. always surviving from donations and grants.  Money is always difficult to find, and it doesn't usually go for the "frills."  Cameras would be considered extra..and there is never money for this. But for me, having the students exposed to a creative avenue for expressing themselves, while at the same time developing a open channel of communication between another culture is a win win.

What We Need & What You Need to Do

Ideally, I need 2000.00 to buy digital cameras.  I would like to get fifteen cameras in case some break or the humidity gets to them. The total amount that is donated will be used entirely for buying cameras.  Someone in the states will bring them down to us on their next trip because buying them in the states is more cost effective. If the total requested amount does not come, I will use what is donated to buy as many cameras as possible. Please donate through PayPal at reinerts@sbcglobal.net

Other Ways You Can Help

People can go to the Yachana website and donate there by earmarking funds to go to "cameras for the high school."  www.yachana.org.ec

story:
Speak your mind kampanjen

Sverige är ett land som lider av ökade samhällsklyftor. Ungdomar går sysslolösa och arbetslösa. Speak your mind festival är Pantrarnas nu tredje årliga första maj festival. Nytt för i år var att vi flyttade festivalen till Angered. Detta gjorde vi för att vi anser att festivalen och förortsrörelsen inte är enbart en fråga om Biskopsgården utan att de frågorna berör alla förorter i Göteborg, såväl som Sverige. På längre sikt har vi en vision om Speak your mind festivalen som en resande festival, som varje år dyker upp i en ny förort.

Vi planerade inför festivalen att anlita 6-8 ordningsvakter vilka vi hade ansökt projektmedel och gjort upp en budget för. Något som stod med när vi först ansökte om tillståndet. Men två dagar innan festivalen får vi ett krav från polisen att dubbla antalet ordningsvakter eller så tar de tillbaka tillståndet. De hotade även med böter om vi inte uppfyllde kravet, vilket skulle dubbla vår säkerhetsbudget med pengar vi inte hade.

 Detta samtidigt som 14000 personer firade första maj i innerstan, helt utan krav på några ordningsvakter alls. Vi anser att polisens krav var orättvisa då innerstan inte hade samma krav för sitt första maj firande och orimliga eftersom kravet kom två dagar innan festivalen, mot en relativt lite och ideell förening.

Vad vi kommer göra med pengarna

Vi har tagit kontakt med jurister och kommer bestrida kravet och fakturan. Men för att föreningen och festivalen ska överleva behöver vi folkets stöd om de inte lyckas. 

  • Vi är stolta över att tre år i rad, med volontärer och andra organisationers hjälp annordnat en så stor och lyckad festival i Biskopsgården och nu i Angered. En festival där Sveriges största hiphop artister uppträder gratis i solidaritet till folket och förortsrörelsen. 
  • Vi är djupt tacksamma av allas stöd och till publiken som kom och bidrog med stämmningen. Men för att föreningen och festivalen ska överleva behöver vi nu erat stöd.
  • Om vi inte lyckas överklaga polisens tillstånds krav kommer hela summan gå till att betala fakturan. Lyckas vi överklaga kommer pengarna gå till nästa festivalkassa. 

Speak your mind 2015...

Speak your mind har verkat som en återkommande katalysator för medborgerligt engagemang. Festivalen har  växt i storlek och anseende sedan starten 2011. Mycket tack vare att vi har från starten fick besök av framstående civilrättsaktivister som Bobby Seale, grundaren av Black panther party och Emory Douglas, kulturminister för Black panther party. Till att vi förra året nästan fyllde svertemossen till kapacitet, då tusentals besökare från hela Göteborg utan att riktigt veta vart Svartemossen låg trotsade det kalla vädret för att fira första maj i Biskopsgården. Det var en dag då man gratis kunde lyssna på Sveriges största Hiphop artister, internationella artister som Dead prez  och höra ett första maj framförande av Svarta Pantrarnas kulturminister Emory Douglas. Allt på en fotbollsplan i Svartemossen tillsammans med vänner, familj och främlingar. Men framförallt likasinnade. Personer som aldrig vågat ta sig till Biskopsgården fick nu chansen att se att det inte är fullt så farligt som media uppvisar. Samtidigt som man som Biskopsbo kan se att de finns tusentals personer utanför Biskopsgården som tror på ett samhälle fritt från segregation, inte bara genom ord utan att de även vågar ta sig ut från centrum och in till förorten för att tillsammans fira en av Sveriges folkkäraste högtider. Vi ville därför i år ta denna folkrörelse vidare och belysa Angered, och i framtiden, andra områden i Göteborg. För att sen på sikt sluta samman i segregerade områden i hela Sverige för att tillsammans med alla medborgare som värnar om civilrätt mobilisera verklig förändring och utveckling av vårt Sverige.


      Andra sätt man kan bidra

      Om du inte kan donera själv så dela gärna kampanjen till vänner och bekanta. All hjälp är bra hjälp och all makt till folket!

story:
***UPDATE: Thank you SO much - we have achieved not one, but TWO goals for this campaign, and because of you we will be able to provide thousands of kids with a mentor. Please don't stop now - every dollar counts and will make a big difference for our kids. 


Support Our New Ambassador Program

Because our teachers and Principals have told us they and their kids would be excited - we have begun a pilot program to utilize people who do AMAZING things outside of sports. We are beginning to work with writers, artists, coders, entrepreneurs and all around amazing people who do amazing things to be volunteer mentors to kids across the continent and we need your help to make it happen! 

**Scroll to the bottom to take a look at the gear that goes along with each impact you make**

What We Need & What You Get

This campaign will fund a pilot for our Ambassador Program – giving more kids the opportunity to learn from inspiring figures who role model the process of excellence and teach kids about what it takes to set goals, persevere, and achieve.  We have a huge wait list of amazing teachers, and demand for our programming grows every day. Your gift will help us develop this program, reaching 1,500 students in the near term and many thousands more down the road.

This is what your funds will make happen:

  • Mentor recruitment, selection and training
  • Teacher selection and training
  • Curriculum development
  • Video editing 
  • Scheduling and conducting Google Hangouts between mentors and classrooms
  • Teacher and mentor support
  • Teacher network/community development
  • Really. Amazing. Experiences. For 1,500 kids. (50 classrooms * 30 students = 1,500 students)

Any funds raised over our $10,000 goal will be used to bring on additional mentors and classrooms – that means more lives changed, and more kids set up for success!

Two-time Olympic Medalist and national champion Elana Meyers visits her students in Phildelphia, PA.


We're Proud Of This: Our Impact on Kids

We believe every child has the right to learn the process of excellence, yet many students in under-served communities face significant barriers to gaining these critical skills. Therefore we work hard to partner with teachers to instill qualities of excellence in students that will last the rest of their lives.


We measure for improvements in key areas for students’ future success including goal setting ability and perseverance, school engagement, digital literacy, and interpersonal skills; areas that lead to increased academic performance. 

* for more information on how we help kids, click here.

(l) Gold medalists Meryl Davis & Charlie White chat with  their students in Denver;       

(r) Bronze medalist Erin Hamlin visits students in Wisconsin.


We see some really amazing impacts happen in the classrooms we work with. A couple examples are student improvements in...

                    

 


Other Ways You Can Help

Right now, what we need most is the financial resources to help us make things happen. What can you do? Spread the word, tell the story of why you are involved, and invite others to join you in giving. Share our cause with your workplace. Find out if your employer has a donation match program. Here are some ideas:

  • Share Classroom Champions’ campaign with your family, friends, and social networks.
  • When you share with family and friends, send a personal email, message, or even a phone call. 
  • When you share on social media, tag @ClassroomChamps. Here is this fundraiser link to share with your friends and family: http://igg.me/at/ClassroomChampions2014
  • If you would like to make a video of yourself sharing why you donated to Classroom Champions and why you feel play is important, please send it to us and we will share on the campaign's media gallery and on our social media outlets

*You will receive an email from us soon after you've confirmed your donation. We'll want to know what gender and size you'd like if you've chosen a park that includes clothing... so keep an eye out for it - we've got you covered!*

**You will receive a  U.S. tax  deductible receipt for between 85-100% of your donation, dependent upon the perk you have chosen.**

Coffee Mug    


Tee Shirts (Ladies & Mens cuts)  


Zip Hoodies (Ladies, Mens)

 


Limited Edition Tees (Ladies, Mens)

story: Our sorority Phi Beta Chi is having our National Convention in Chicago this August! We are raising money to send our representatives Lupita Hernandez  and Victoria Alyxx Perez to this amazing educational experience. It's ONLY $800 for a round trip for BOTH our sisters. Them being able to attend means the Pi Chapter growing in spirituality, sisterhood, and education. Our budget will cover their conference fee, food and hotel.  Every dollar helps so please donate anything you can even if it's only a dollar. Then please share. This will mean a lot to them and the sooner we get the $$ together the better....plane tickets only go up in price.  So let's make this happen for them!!'
