story:
FINAL UPDATE:

Dear Friends,

Please act now to make the video documentary and Spanish teaching materials of the 2014 Vivir Despiertos tour a reality. Your donation, however small, can make the mindfulness teachings given on the recently completed six-week tour available to hundreds of thousands of Spanish speakers free online.

We are in the final week of our fundraising campaign for what has been an incredible mindfulness tour in Chile, Ecuador, Colombia, Nicaragua and Mexico. Thanks to funds from the Thich Nhat Hanh Legacy Foundation and what we have raised so far we have been able to fund the trip, but to edit the raw footage filmed by Dutch filmmaker Wouter Verhoeven we still need to meet our goal of $37,000 with only a few days left!

All those who have already donated, as well as those of you donating until the end of the campaign will enjoy a special preview link of the documentary as it comes to completion this coming spring of 2015. Without your donation we will be unable to cover the considerable costs over the next months of editing more than a terabyte of HD video material to make the documentary and other materials available to all.

Thank you for your donation, and may we see you soon in Plum Village or Magnolia Grove Monastery.

Br. Phap Luu and the Vivir Despiertos Team

VIDEO UPDATE:


Dear Friends,
Please enjoy the short video update and thanks above from the monastics on tour in South America. They are in their third country, Colombia, after retreats, Days of Mindfulness for Educators, Wake Up Events and public talks in Santiago, Chile and Quito, Ecuador.
We are almost halfway there with fundraising for the tour, but in these last weeks of the campaign we still need your help. Thank you for sharing this campaign widely with friends, family, Sangha members and your wider community. Together we are making positive change a reality!
Read more about the trip on our blog here.

A Wake Up Tour in Latin America

We ask you now to take action.

Your tax-deductible donation will make it possible for seven Plum Village monastics, Dharma teachers and disciples of Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh, to introduce thousands of children, young people, activists, teachers and others to the practice of mindfulness and awakening through retreats, Days of Mindfulness for Educators, Wake Up events for young people and public talks in Santiago, Chile; Quito, Ecuador; Bogotá, Colombia; Managua, Nicaragua; and México City, México this fall from September 21st to November 4th, 2014.

We need to train thousands of mindfulness teachers, hundreds of thousands of teachers, because everywhere needs the practice of mindfulness. — Thich Nhat Hanh

For the past twenty years the teachings of Thich Nhat Hanh (Thay) and Plum Village have been quietly spreading through the Spanish-speaking world, as Thay's books were translated from English into Spanish. In the past six years this wave of material has been joined by subtitled video Dharma talks and audio recordings of translations.

This year, 2014, is a watershed year: the trickle has become a flood. Thich Nhat Hanh and 57 of his monastic students arrived in Madrid, Spain, on April 25th to kick off the first ever Plum Village tour in a Spanish-speaking country. A handful of dedicated practitioners from Latin America were able to raise funds to join Thay on this tour, but the cost of flying, and the disparity in the cost of living between there and Europe, makes the voyage difficult for all but a few.

We have since used some of these mindfulness practices with directors of high schools (Colegios de Bachilleres de Chiapas COBAH) and some professors. I am sure that this is the way to begin watering the seeds, so that we can go on working with indigenous girls and boys and adolescents. In this way we are going to carry out what was discussed in the sharing circles on the 2014 Spain Tour about Wake Up Schools.  — Maria Marilu Jimenez Lopez, Chiapas, México

This Wake Up tour will bring Spanish-speaking Plum Village monks and nuns directly to five countries in Latin America: Chile, Ecuador, Colombia, Nicaragua and México. Instead of just a handful of people having access to these practices and teachings, the tour reaches out to thousands of people interested in Thay's teachings in these countries and gives them the opportunity to bring mindfulness practice into their families, schools, and communities.

If we are able to surpass our goal of raising $37,000 for this tour we will also be able to invite filmmaker Wouter Verhoeven to join us to film the events of the tour, creating an invaluable set of Spanish video resources on the practices of Plum Village and Wake Up Schools. All donors to this campaign will additionally receive a link to the Wake Up Schools as-yet-unreleased film, filmed and edited by Wouter, called "Happy Teachers Will Change the World." 

We really need your help to plant these seeds. The travel costs of the tour alone are approximately $5,000 per monastic, and there are only a handful of dedicated volunteers in each country working with very little financial support. This tour could not be possible without donations from those of us in countries like the U.S. and Europe who are fortunate enough to have retreats and monastics nearby and accessible to us year-round.

NOTE: The organizing team in Nicaragua has arranged with local tree-planting ecologists, who will attend the retreat in Managua, to plant 500 trees in the Bosawás Biosphere Reserve as a carbon-offset to the air travel from the tour.

Here are some highlights of the tour as it stands now:

Chile

(21-30 of September, 2014)

  • Day of Mindfulness with teens in the Pedro Apostol School in Puente Alto (340 students)
  • Public Talk at the Auditorio de Telefonica (200 people)
  • Wake Up Schools: Mindfulness in Higher Education for students in training to become teachers, Estadio Universidad Mayor, (800 students)
  • Wake Up Schools: Mindfulness in K-12 at the Centro Patrimonial Recoleta Dominica for current teachers
  • Wake Up Event for Young People 18-35 in Santiago
  • 2-Day Mindfulness Retreat at Punto Zero, Putaendo (100 people)

"Los niños felices cambiarán el mundo": Happy Children Will Change the World.

Ecuador

(1-7 of October)

  • The Ministry of Education of Ecuador is bringing 200 teachers responsible for innovation from around the country to a Day of Mindfulness for Educators (200 teachers)
  • 2-Day Retreat at the Center for Integral Health (100 people)
  • Wake Up Event for Young People at Universidad Andina Simon Bolivar (100 people)

Colombia

(8-15 of October)

  • Wake Up Public Talk at the University of the Andes (150 people)
  • Afternoon of Mindfulness at the Student Union of the University of the Andes (100 people)
  • 3-Day Retreat at La Calera (80 people)

Nicaragua

(16-21 of October)

  • Universidad Centroamericana (UCA) 4-hour program focused on reaching youth,  students, and educators  (50 people)
  • Alianza Francesa 2-hour public talk (200 people) to the general public
  • 2-Day Mindfulness Retreat with retreatants including youth from two organizations that work with former street children, a community arts center for women and youth, and members of other grassroots organizations, as well as young university teachers, activists, and folks who are part of Nicaragua's natural medicine network. (80 people)
  • Visit to the La Garnacha farming cooperative 
  • Tree-planting by local ecologists as a carbon-offset to the air travel from the tour (500 trees)

Mexico

(22 October to 4 November)

  • Day of Mindfulness for Educators at the National Autonomous University of México (250 people)
  • Flashmob Meditation and Public Talk in Coyoacan (300 people)
  • Wake Up Event for Young People in the Iberoamerican University (200 people)
  • 4-Day Retreat "The Art of Waking Up to Our Ancestors" (120 people)

    What is Vivir Despiertos (Wake Up)?

    Wake Up is an active global community of young mindfulness practitioners, both monastic and lay, inspired by the teachings of Zen Master and peace activist Thich Nhat Hanh. We come together to practice mindfulness in order to take care of ourselves, nourish happiness and contribute to building a healthier and a more compassionate society.

    We want to help our world which is overloaded with intolerance, discrimination, craving, anger and despair. Seeing the environmental degradation caused by our society, we want to live in such a way that our planet Earth can survive for a long time.

    Practicing mindfulness, concentration and insight enables us to cultivate tolerance, non-discrimination, understanding and compassion in ourselves and the world.

    Our Practice

    We follow the Five Mindfulness Trainings, which are ethical guidelines that offer concrete practices of true love and compassion, and a path towards a life in harmony with each other and the Earth. These guidelines are the foundation of our lives and represent our ideal of service.

    Our practice is based on cultivating awareness of the breath and living deeply in the present moment, aware of what is happening within us and around us. This practice helps us to release the tension in our bodies and feelings, to live life deeply and more happily, and to use compassionate listening and loving speech to help restore communication and reconcile with others.

    Roots of Wake Up: Inclusiveness

    The Wake Up movement is inspired by Buddhism’s long tradition of wisdom and practices which help cultivate understanding and love; it is not based on beliefs or ideology. The spirit of our practice is close to the spirit of science; both help us cultivate an open and non-discriminating mind. We honor everyone’s diverse spiritual and cultural roots. You can join as a Christian, a Jew, a Muslim, as an agnostic or atheist, or member of any other spiritual or religious tradition.

    What We Do

    We aspire to be a place of refuge, nourishment and support for anyone with an aspiration to transform their own suffering and contribute to a healthy and compassionate society. We gather weekly or monthly in Wake Up groups to practice sitting and walking meditation, to listen to a teaching, practice total relaxation, listen deeply to one another, and recite the Five Mindfulness Trainings.

    We also organize mindfulness events and retreats on Wake Up Tours like this one.

    Vivir Despiertos T-Shirts and Hoodies

    We're happy to offer a t-shirt, for donations of $50, or hoodie, for donations of $100 and up, as a thanks to you for your support.  They are designed based on our teacher Thay's calligraphy "Vivir Despiertos" meaning "Wake Up" in Spanish:

              Dark Chocolate T-Shirt                                Chocolate Hoodie                 

    For those who generously offer $300 we will send you a small (approx. 4 x 6 inch) original Thich Nhat Hanh calligraphy on rice paper, and for $500 and up a medium (approx. 8.5 x 11 inch) calligraphy. To learn more about Thay's art of calligraphy, and to see some examples, please visit http://www.thichnhathanhcalligraphy.org.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Donations are great, but we also need help to spread the word! 

    Here are some ideas of how you can help us realize the dream of this Latin American tour:

    1. "Like" our campaign by using the "like" button above.
    2. "Share" our campaign on your Facebook wall and Twitter, asking people to support us and "Like" our campaign.  Let people know it's great to "like" your Facebook post, but it helps us much more if they "like" the actual campaign on this site.
    3. Email our campaign to your friends, family, sangha, colleagues, and networks.
    4. Make a “Comment” and tell us what you think of what we're doing!

    Thank you, and may you be happy, healthy and free from fear.

    The Vivir Despiertos Team / El Equipo Vivir Despiertos

                Sister Jina                        Brother Pháp Liệu              Brother Pháp Lưu 

            Sister Hài Nghiêm               Sister Sứ Nghiêm              Brother Pháp Khải

          Brother Pháp Thệ      Aurora Leon/Joaquin Carral      Wouter Verhoeven

    La Gira Vivir Despiertos en América Latina

    Te pedimos ahora tu acción.

    Tu donación, que puede ser deducible de impuestos en los E.E.U.U., hará posible que siete monásticos de Plum Village, Maestros del Dharma y discípulos del Maestro Zen Thich Nhat Hanh puedan presentar a miles de niños, jóvenes, activistas, maestros y profesores y tantos otros más, la práctica de la plena conciencia y del despertar, a través de retiros, Jornadas de Plena Conciencia para Educadores, Eventos de Vivir Despiertos para los jóvenes con charlas públicas en Santiago, Chile; Quito, Ecuador; Bogotá, Colombia; Managua, Nicaragua; y Ciudad de México, México, en ésta primavera desde el 21 de Septiembre al 04 de Noviembre de 2014.


    Necesitamos entrenar miles de maestros conscientes, decenas de miles de maestros, porque en todo lugar se necesita la práctica de la plena conciencia. — Thich Nhat Hanh

    Durante los últimos veinte años las enseñanzas de Thich Nhat Hanh y de Plum Village se han ido expandiendo lentamente a través del mundo hispano-hablante, en la medida en que sus libros han comenzado a ser traducidos del Inglés al Español. En los últimos seis años mucho material se ha compartido también bajo la forma de videos subtitulados de las charlas del Dharma y también grabaciones en audio de sus traducciones.

    Este año, 2014, ha sido un punto de inflexión: el fino hilo de agua nos ha inundado. Thich Nhat Hanh y 57 de sus discípulos monásticos desembarcaron en Madrid, España, el 25 de Abril, para dar inicio a la primera gira de Plum Village en un país hispanohablante. Un puñado de practicantes Latinoamericanos muy dedicados fueron capaces de juntar los fondos necesarios para acompañar a Thay en ésta gira, pero el costo de viajar en avión, la disparidad del costo de vida entre América Latina y Europa, hizo que ese viaje fuera muy difícil para la gran mayoría, y apenas unos pocos pudieron afrontarlo.


    Ya hemos utilizado algunas de las prácticas de la plena conciencia con directores de las escuelas secundarias (Colegios de Bachilleres de Chiapas COBAH) y también con algunos profesores. Estoy segura que ésta es la manera de comenzar a regar las semillas, para así poder continuar trabajando con niños y niñas y adolescentes indígenas. De ésta forma podremos llevar adelante lo que fue discutido en nuestras rondas de intercambio y compartir durante la Gira Española de 2014, sobre el tema de las Escuelas Despiertas. — Maria Marilu Jimenez Lopez, Chiapas, México

    Esta Gira de Vivir Despiertos (Wake Up) nos traerá un grupo de siete monásticos hispano-hablantes de Plum Village, quienes vendrán a cinco países de Latinoamérica: Chile, Ecuador, Colombia, Nicaragua y México. Esta Gira permitirá tener acceso a las enseñanzas y prácticas, ya no solo a unos pocos sino a millares de personas interesadas en las enseñanzas de Thay en todos éstos países, brindándoles la oportunidad de acercar la práctica de la plena conciencia a sus familias, escuelas y toda su comunidad.

    Realmente necesitamos tu ayuda para plantar ésta semillas. Los costos de  viaje de la Gira son sustancialmente altos; hay apenas un puñado de voluntarios en cada país y tienen poca ayuda financiera. Esta gira no sería posible sin las donaciones de aquellos que vivimos en países como los Estados Unidos, Cánada, o países de Europa que son lo suficientemente afortunados como para tener los retiros de Thay y a los monásticos geográficamente cerca y accesibles a lo largo de todo el año.

    Aquí abajo destacamos algunos puntos de la Gira, según está diagramado hoy día:

    Chile

    (21-30 de Septiembre, 2014)

    • Día de Plena Conciencia con adolescentes en el Colegio de San Pedro Apóstol en Puente Alto (340 estudiantes).
    • Charla Pública en el Auditorio de Telefónica (300 personas).
    • Escuelas Vivir Despiertos: la Plena Conciencia en la Educación Secundaria para estudiantes entrenándose para el Profesorado.
    • Escuelas Vivir Despiertos: la Plena Conciencia en K-12 en el Centro Patrimonial Recoleta Dominica para maestros en actividad.
    • Evento de Vivir Despiertos (Wake Up) para jóvenes de 18-35 años, en Santiago.
    • Retiro de 2 días en Punto Cero, Putaendo (100 personas).

    Ecuador

    (1-7 de Octubre)

    • El Ministerio de Educación de Ecuador traerá 200 maestros, responsables por la innovación, provenientes de todo el país, para un Día de Plena Conciencia para Educadores (200 maestros).
    • Retiro de 2 días en el Centro Integral Para la Salud (100 personas).
    • Evento de Vivir Despiertos (Wake Up) para jóvenes, en la Universidad Andina Simón Bolivar (100 personas).

    Colombia

    (8-15 de Octubre)

    • Charla de Vivir Despiertos (Wake Up) en la Universidad de los Andes (150 personas)
    • Tarde de Plena Conciencia en la Unión de Estudiantes de la Universidad de los Andes (100 personas).
    • 3 días de Retiro en La Calera (80 personas).

    Nicaragua

    (16-21 de Octubre)

    • Programa de 4 horas en la Universidad Centroamericana, con enfoque principal en la juventud y los estudiantes (80 personas).
    • Charla pública de 2 horas en la Alianza Francesa (150 personas).
    • Retiro de Plena Conciencia de 2 días. Entre los participantes están dos organizaciones  que trabajan con niños que antes estaban en la calle, Los Quinchos y Casa Alianza, un centro artístico comunitario para la mujer y la juventud en Managua, profesores universitarios jóvenes y personas que son parte de la red de medicina natural (80 personas).
    • Plantar árboles con los ecologistas locales en Bosawás - Reserva de la Biosfera y visita a la comunidad religiosa La Garnacha (500 árboles).

    Mexico

    (22 de Octubre – 4 de Noviembre)

    • Día de Plena Conciencia para Educadores en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Méjico (250 personas).
    • Meditación Flashmob y Charla Pública en Coyoacan (300 personas).
    • Evento de Vivir Despiertos para gente joven, en la Universidad Iberomaricana (200 personas).
    • Retiro de cuatro días: “El arte de vivir despiertos con nuestros ancestros” (120 personas).

    Que es Vivir Despiertos (Wake Up)?

    Vivir Despiertos (Wake Up) es una comunidad global de jóvenes practicantes de la plena conciencia inspirados en las enseñanzas del Maestro Zen y activista de la Paz, Thich Nhat Hanh. Nos reunimos para practicar la plena conciencia para así nutrir nuestra felicidad, cuidar de nosotros mismos y ayudar a construir una sociedad más sana y compasiva.

    Queremos ayudar y mejorar nuestro mundo actual tan cargado de intolerancia, discriminación, adicciones, ira y desesperación. Atentos a la degradación del medio ambiente causada por nuestra sociedad, queremos vivir de una manera tal que ayudemos a nuestro planeta Tierra a existir por mucho más tiempo.

    La práctica de mindfulness o plena conciencia, de la concentración y de la visión profunda nos permite cultivar la tolerancia, la comprensión y la compasión, en nosotros mismos y en el mundo.

    Nuestra práctica

    Estudiamos y practicamos Los Cinco Entrenamientos de la Plena Conciencia, que son una guía ética que nos ofrece prácticas concretas sobre el verdadero amor y la compasión, y un camino para vivir en armonía entre todos y con nuestro planeta. Esta Guía son la base sobre la que vivimos nuestras vidas y representan nuestra ideal de servicio para con la sociedad.

    Las raíces de Vivir Despiertos: Inclusividad

    El movimiento de Vivir Despiertos está inspirado en la larga tradición Budista de sabiduría y prácticas que ayudan a cultivar la comprensión y el amor; no se basa en creencias o ideologías. El espíritu de nuestra práctica se acerca al espíritu de la ciencia; ambos nos ayudan a cultivar una mente abierta y no discriminatoria. Aceptamos y honramos las raíces culturales y espirituales de todos. Puedes acercarte siendo cristiano, judío, musulmán, agnóstico o ateo, o siendo miembro de cualquier otra tradición espiritual o religiosa.

    Que hacemos

    Aspiramos a ser un lugar de refugio, que nutra y dé soporte a cualquiera que tenga la aspiración de transformar su propio sufrimiento y de contribuir para tener una sociedad mas sana y compasiva. Con nuestros grupos de Vivir Despiertos, nos reunimos periódicamente, semanal, quincenal o mensualmente, para practicar la meditación sentados y también caminando, escuchar las Enseñanzas, practicar la relajación total, escucharnos unos a otros con profunda atención y para recitar juntos Los Cinco Entrenamientos de la Plena Conciencia.

    También organizamos eventos y/o retiros de Plena Conciencia en nuestras giras de Vivir Despiertos, como es ésta.  

    "Vivir Despiertos" camisetas y sudaderas con capucha

    Estamos felices de poder ofrecerles una camiseta, para donaciones de USD 50, o una sudadera con capucha para donaciones de USD 100 ó más, como agradecimiento a tu apoyo.  Estas prendas están diseñadas sobre la base de las caligrafías de "Vivir Despiertos", de nuestro maestro Thay: 


                     Camiseta Marrón Oscuro                 Sudadera color chocolate

    Para quienes que generosamente contribuyan con donaciones de USD 300 les enviaremos una pequeña caligrafía original de Thich Nhat Hanh, en papel de arroz (aprox. 10x15 cm); y para donaciones de USD 500 o más una de tamaño mediano (aprox. 22x28 cm). Para conocer más sobre el arte de las caligrafías de Thich Nhat Hanh y ver algunos ejemplos, puedes visitar http://www.thichnhathanhcalligraphy.org

    Otras maneras en que puedes ayudarnos

    Las donaciones son geniales, pero también necesitamos hacer correr la voz! 

    Aquí presentamos algunas ideas de cómo nos puedes ayudar a hacer realidad éste sueño de la Gira de Latinoamérica: 

    1. Dar "Me Gusta" en nuestra campaña  usando el botón "me gusta" más arriba.
    2. "Compartir" nuestra campaña en tu muro de Facebook y Twitter, pidiéndole a tus amigos que nos brinden su apoyo dando "Me Gusta" en nuestra campaña.  Déjale saber a tus amigos que está muy bueno que coloquen “me gusta” en tu muro, pero que nos ayudará muchísimo si colocan “Me Gusta” en nuestra campaña en la web.
    3. Envía nuestra campaña por email a todos tus amigos, familiares, sangha, colegas y grupos en que participes.
    4. Haz un “Comentario” y dinos que piensas de nuestro trabajo!

    Muchas gracias, que estés bien, feliz, sano y libre de toda aflicción.

    El Equipo de Vivir Despiertos

Without your donation we will be unable to cover the considerable costs over the next months of editing more than a terabyte of HD video material to make the documentary and other materials available to all.Thank you for your donation, and may we see you soon in Plum Village or Magnolia Grove Monastery.Br. We ask you now to take action.Your tax-deductible donation will make it possible for seven Plum Village monastics, Dharma teachers and disciples of Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh, to introduce thousands of children, young people, activists, teachers and others to the practice of mindfulness and awakening through retreats, Days of Mindfulness for Educators, Wake Up events for young people and public talks in Santiago, Chile; Quito, Ecuador; Bogotá, Colombia; Managua, Nicaragua; and México City, México this fall from September 21st to November 4th, 2014.We need to train thousands of mindfulness teachers, hundreds of thousands of teachers, because everywhere needs the practice of mindfulness. — Thich Nhat Hanh

We're happy to offer a t-shirt, for donations of $50, or hoodie, for donations of $100 and up, as a thanks to you for your support.  They are designed based on our teacher Thay's calligraphy "Vivir Despiertos" meaning "Wake Up" in Spanish:




          Dark Chocolate T-Shirt                                Chocolate Hoodie                 

For those who generously offer $300 we will send you a small (approx. 4 x 6 inch) original Thich Nhat Hanh calligraphy on rice paper, and for $500 and up a medium (approx. 8.5 x 11 inch) calligraphy. To learn more about Thay's art of calligraphy, and to see some examples, please visit http://www.thichnhathanhcalligraphy.org.

Other Ways You Can Help
Donations are great, but we also need help to spread the word! 
Here are some ideas of how you can help us realize the dream of this Latin American tour:


"Like" our campaign by using the "like" button above.

"Share" our campaign on your Facebook wall and Twitter, asking people to support us and "Like" our campaign.  Let people know it's great to "like" your Facebook post, but it helps us much more if they "like" the actual campaign on this site.

Email our campaign to your friends, family, sangha, colleagues, and networks.

Make a “Comment” and tell us what you think of what we're doing!

Thank you, and may you be happy, healthy and free from fear.
The Vivir Despiertos Team / El Equipo Vivir Despiertos


            Sister Jina                        Brother Pháp Liệu              Brother Pháp Lưu 




        Sister Hài Nghiêm               Sister Sứ Nghiêm              Brother Pháp Khải


      Brother Pháp Thệ      Aurora Leon/Joaquin Carral      Wouter Verhoeven


La Gira Vivir Despiertos en América Latina
Te pedimos ahora tu acción.
Tu donación, que puede ser deducible de impuestos en los E.E.U.U., hará posible que siete monásticos de Plum Village, Maestros del Dharma y discípulos del Maestro Zen Thich Nhat Hanh puedan presentar a miles de niños, jóvenes, activistas, maestros y profesores y tantos otros más, la práctica de la plena conciencia y del despertar, a través de retiros, Jornadas de Plena Conciencia para Educadores, Eventos de Vivir Despiertos para los jóvenes con charlas públicas en Santiago, Chile; Quito, Ecuador; Bogotá, Colombia; Managua, Nicaragua; y Ciudad de México, México, en ésta primavera desde el 21 de Septiembre al 04 de Noviembre de 2014.


Necesitamos entrenar miles de maestros conscientes, decenas de miles de maestros, porque en todo lugar se necesita la práctica de la plena conciencia. — Thich Nhat Hanh

Durante los últimos veinte años las enseñanzas de Thich Nhat Hanh y de Plum Village se han ido expandiendo lentamente a través del mundo hispano-hablante, en la medida en que sus libros han comenzado a ser traducidos del Inglés al Español. En los últimos seis años mucho material se ha compartido también bajo la forma de videos subtitulados de las charlas del Dharma y también grabaciones en audio de sus traducciones.


Este año, 2014, ha sido un punto de inflexión: el fino hilo de agua nos ha inundado. Thich Nhat Hanh y 57 de sus discípulos monásticos desembarcaron en Madrid, España, el 25 de Abril, para dar inicio a la primera gira de Plum Village en un país hispanohablante. Un puñado de practicantes Latinoamericanos muy dedicados fueron capaces de juntar los fondos necesarios para acompañar a Thay en ésta gira, pero el costo de viajar en avión, la disparidad del costo de vida entre América Latina y Europa, hizo que ese viaje fuera muy difícil para la gran mayoría, y apenas unos pocos pudieron afrontarlo.



Ya hemos utilizado algunas de las prácticas de la plena conciencia con directores de las escuelas secundarias (Colegios de Bachilleres de Chiapas COBAH) y también con algunos profesores. Estoy segura que ésta es la manera de comenzar a regar las semillas, para así poder continuar trabajando con niños y niñas y adolescentes indígenas. De ésta forma podremos llevar adelante lo que fue discutido en nuestras rondas de intercambio y compartir durante la Gira Española de 2014, sobre el tema de las Escuelas Despiertas. — Maria Marilu Jimenez Lopez, Chiapas, México

Esta Gira de Vivir Despiertos (Wake Up) nos traerá un grupo de siete monásticos hispano-hablantes de Plum Village, quienes vendrán a cinco países de Latinoamérica: Chile, Ecuador, Colombia, Nicaragua y México. Esta Gira permitirá tener acceso a las enseñanzas y prácticas, ya no solo a unos pocos sino a millares de personas interesadas en las enseñanzas de Thay en todos éstos países, brindándoles la oportunidad de acercar la práctica de la plena conciencia a sus familias, escuelas y toda su comunidad.


Realmente necesitamos tu ayuda para plantar ésta semillas. Los costos de  viaje de la Gira son sustancialmente altos; hay apenas un puñado de voluntarios en cada país y tienen poca ayuda financiera. Esta gira no sería posible sin las donaciones de aquellos que vivimos en países como los Estados Unidos, Cánada, o países de Europa que son lo suficientemente afortunados como para tener los retiros de Thay y a los monásticos geográficamente cerca y accesibles a lo largo de todo el año.
Aquí abajo destacamos algunos puntos de la Gira, según está diagramado hoy día:
Chile
(21-30 de Septiembre, 2014)



Día de Plena Conciencia con adolescentes en el Colegio de San Pedro Apóstol en Puente Alto (340 estudiantes).


Charla Pública en el Auditorio de Telefónica (300 personas).


Escuelas Vivir Despiertos: la Plena Conciencia en la Educación Secundaria para estudiantes entrenándose para el Profesorado.


Escuelas Vivir Despiertos: la Plena Conciencia en K-12 en el Centro Patrimonial Recoleta Dominica para maestros en actividad.


Evento de Vivir Despiertos (Wake Up) para jóvenes de 18-35 años, en Santiago.

Retiro de 2 días en Punto Cero, Putaendo (100 personas).


Ecuador
(1-7 de Octubre)



El Ministerio de Educación de Ecuador traerá 200 maestros, responsables por la innovación, provenientes de todo el país, para un Día de Plena Conciencia para Educadores (200 maestros).


Retiro de 2 días en el Centro Integral Para la Salud (100 personas).


Evento de Vivir Despiertos (Wake Up) para jóvenes, en la Universidad Andina Simón Bolivar (100 personas).






Colombia
(8-15 de Octubre)



Charla de Vivir Despiertos (Wake Up) en la Universidad de los Andes (150 personas)


Tarde de Plena Conciencia en la Unión de Estudiantes de la Universidad de los Andes (100 personas).


3 días de Retiro en La Calera (80 personas).





Nicaragua
(16-21 de Octubre)



Programa de 4 horas en la Universidad Centroamericana, con enfoque principal en la juventud y los estudiantes (80 personas).


Charla pública de 2 horas en la Alianza Francesa (150 personas).


Retiro de Plena Conciencia de 2 días. Entre los participantes están dos organizaciones  que trabajan con niños que antes estaban en la calle, Los Quinchos y Casa Alianza, un centro artístico comunitario para la mujer y la juventud en Managua, profesores universitarios jóvenes y personas que son parte de la red de medicina natural (80 personas).

Plantar árboles con los ecologistas locales en Bosawás - Reserva de la Biosfera y visita a la comunidad religiosa La Garnacha (500 árboles).


Mexico
(22 de Octubre – 4 de Noviembre)



Día de Plena Conciencia para Educadores en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Méjico (250 personas).


Meditación Flashmob y Charla Pública en Coyoacan (300 personas).


Evento de Vivir Despiertos para gente joven, en la Universidad Iberomaricana (200 personas).

Retiro de cuatro días: “El arte de vivir despiertos con nuestros ancestros” (120 personas).


Que es Vivir Despiertos (Wake Up)?
Vivir Despiertos (Wake Up) es una comunidad global de jóvenes practicantes de la plena conciencia inspirados en las enseñanzas del Maestro Zen y activista de la Paz, Thich Nhat Hanh. Nos reunimos para practicar la plena conciencia para así nutrir nuestra felicidad, cuidar de nosotros mismos y ayudar a construir una sociedad más sana y compasiva.
Queremos ayudar y mejorar nuestro mundo actual tan cargado de intolerancia, discriminación, adicciones, ira y desesperación. Atentos a la degradación del medio ambiente causada por nuestra sociedad, queremos vivir de una manera tal que ayudemos a nuestro planeta Tierra a existir por mucho más tiempo.
La práctica de mindfulness o plena conciencia, de la concentración y de la visión profunda nos permite cultivar la tolerancia, la comprensión y la compasión, en nosotros mismos y en el mundo.
Nuestra práctica
Estudiamos y practicamos Los Cinco Entrenamientos de la Plena Conciencia, que son una guía ética que nos ofrece prácticas concretas sobre el verdadero amor y la compasión, y un camino para vivir en armonía entre todos y con nuestro planeta. Esta Guía son la base sobre la que vivimos nuestras vidas y representan nuestra ideal de servicio para con la sociedad.
Las raíces de Vivir Despiertos: Inclusividad
El movimiento de Vivir Despiertos está inspirado en la larga tradición Budista de sabiduría y prácticas que ayudan a cultivar la comprensión y el amor; no se basa en creencias o ideologías. El espíritu de nuestra práctica se acerca al espíritu de la ciencia; ambos nos ayudan a cultivar una mente abierta y no discriminatoria. Aceptamos y honramos las raíces culturales y espirituales de todos. Puedes acercarte siendo cristiano, judío, musulmán, agnóstico o ateo, o siendo miembro de cualquier otra tradición espiritual o religiosa.
Que hacemos
Aspiramos a ser un lugar de refugio, que nutra y dé soporte a cualquiera que tenga la aspiración de transformar su propio sufrimiento y de contribuir para tener una sociedad mas sana y compasiva. Con nuestros grupos de Vivir Despiertos, nos reunimos periódicamente, semanal, quincenal o mensualmente, para practicar la meditación sentados y también caminando, escuchar las Enseñanzas, practicar la relajación total, escucharnos unos a otros con profunda atención y para recitar juntos Los Cinco Entrenamientos de la Plena Conciencia.
También organizamos eventos y/o retiros de Plena Conciencia en nuestras giras de Vivir Despiertos, como es ésta.  
"Vivir Despiertos" camisetas y sudaderas con capucha
Estamos felices de poder ofrecerles una camiseta, para donaciones de USD 50, o una sudadera con capucha para donaciones de USD 100 ó más, como agradecimiento a tu apoyo.  Estas prendas están diseñadas sobre la base de las caligrafías de "Vivir Despiertos", de nuestro maestro Thay: 

                 Camiseta Marrón Oscuro                 Sudadera color chocolate


Para quienes que generosamente contribuyan con donaciones de USD 300 les enviaremos una pequeña caligrafía original de Thich Nhat Hanh, en papel de arroz (aprox. 10x15 cm); y para donaciones de USD 500 o más una de tamaño mediano (aprox. 22x28 cm). Para conocer más sobre el arte de las caligrafías de Thich Nhat Hanh y ver algunos ejemplos, puedes visitar http://www.thichnhathanhcalligraphy.org
Otras maneras en que puedes ayudarnos
Las donaciones son geniales, pero también necesitamos hacer correr la voz! 
Aquí presentamos algunas ideas de cómo nos puedes ayudar a hacer realidad éste sueño de la Gira de Latinoamérica: 



Dar "Me Gusta" en nuestra campaña  usando el botón "me gusta" más arriba.


"Compartir" nuestra campaña en tu muro de Facebook y Twitter, pidiéndole a tus amigos que nos brinden su apoyo dando "Me Gusta" en nuestra campaña.  Déjale saber a tus amigos que está muy bueno que coloquen “me gusta” en tu muro, pero que nos ayudará muchísimo si colocan “Me Gusta” en nuestra campaña en la web.


Envía nuestra campaña por email a todos tus amigos, familiares, sangha, colegas y grupos en que participes.


Haz un “Comentario” y dinos que piensas de nuestro trabajo!



Muchas gracias, que estés bien, feliz, sano y libre de toda aflicción.
El Equipo de Vivir Despiertos

story:
"Learn your language well and command it well, and you will have the first component to life."  -- Edward R. Murrow

"Words are the voice of the heart."  -- Confucius

Having a strong vocabulary is beneficial in so many ways. Not only does it empower students to excel on challenging tests such as the SAT, GRE, and LSAT; but it also gives one authority, the power to communicate effectively and comprehend thoroughly.

The Memory-Flash Vocab Learning System (patent pending) is the culmination of my 15 years as a teacher of English Enrichment and as a tutor and curriculum creator for ACT, SAT, and GRE tests. In my efforts to enhance students' English abilities and prepare them for successful academic careers, I have faced the formidable challenge of teaching hundreds of difficult words in often short periods of time.

The most effective strategy I have discovered is a focus on mnemonics and association, particularly through the study of prefixes, root words, and synonyms. Developing a knowledge of the connections between words enables one to learn several words simultaneously rather than simply one at a time. Furthermore, this system of learning makes use of the brain's natural technique for making long-term memories, the associative process known as consolidation.

Our Goals for the Memory-Flash Learning System and for ACI Publishing

For over 25 years, ACI has been mostly a local business, serving students' needs in the San Gabriel area of Los Angeles.  In my role as curriculum coordinator, however, I've always thought that the insightful and innovative materials I've created for the company could serve a greater good by educating students all around the world.

We are beginning our campaign modestly, seeking to secure enough capital to spend on marketing our Memory Flash Learning System so that we can distribute to a much wider audience. We also seek to garner recognition and interest in our product through the unique approach that crowdfunding and social media offer.

Finally, we hope that the response to our educational tools is so strong that we will reach our stretch goals and be able to produce and publish our next two projects: Set B of our Memory-Flash Vocab Cards and an Exclusive Guide to the NEW SAT.

The Benefits to YOU for Your Support

Most levels of support will receive a box of our Memory-Flash Vocab Cards. The 500 words in Set A are all Essential vocabulary useful for a variety of situations, from academic testing to personal betterment. The cards utilize our patent pending system of symbols, associations, and memory triggers to enable you to learn quicker and form a lasting body of linguistic knowledge. 

With regular Flash Cards and even with high-tech vocabulary websites and phone apps, the process is the same. You look at the word, try to remember it, then you look at the definition. Repeat. Repeat. Repeat. Certainly, repetition is an essential component to learning. HOWEVER, with the Memory-Flash system, you learn the way your brain is designed to learn, by building a network of associations. Almost every card has a symbol on the front intended to trigger an associative clue, empowering you to recall each word more efficiently.

You can find more detailed information at our initial promotional website, but here are two examples to illustrate some fundamental concepts of the Memory-Flash system.

 = warning! commonly confused words or other tricky situation

 = prefix or root word

 = aural (sound) or visual clue

With these two cards, we obviously have a pair of tricky words, words that are easily confused with each other, as indicated by the red octagon. Most people think the word on the left means "related to torture," but not so fast! Check out the clues: RED underlining indicates a definition is similar in look or sound to the underlined part, so it is actually the word on the right that is related to torture. Meanwhile, the BLUE underlining indicates the root word "tort," which means "twist," as in words like "contort" or "distort." Thus, the word on the left means "twisting," as in a tortuous mountain road.

I would assert that one could learn and know the definitions to two words such as these simply through the associative clues and an understanding of our system of symbols. The card backs do present a thorough yet simply-worded definition along with a context sentence, but it is the associations and connections between words that provide the fastest path to increasing one's vocabulary.

With that in mind, I have also designed an exclusive set of Study Guides as a suitable complement to our Memory-Flash Vocab Cards. These laminated guides are dense with information and will fit perfectly in any 3-ring binder as a constant reminder of hundreds of challenging words. At least one Memory-Flash Study Guide comes as a perk with every level of support.

The Study Guides do not provide the definitions for the words, so some research is required of the student. It is suggested that one keep a small notebook to keep track of the words one is learning, using simple definitions and mnemonic clues when possible. Once a student starts to learn the words on the Study Guides, it will become apparent how words are connected together, either by their prefixes, roots, or synonymous meanings, reinforcing the definitions and increasing memory retention.

Furthermore, many of the words are also part of Set A of our Memory-Flash Vocab Cards, so a more scrupulous student with greater aspirations of scholarship would aim for one of the higher tiers of support:

(Shipping is included with all perks.
For International shipping, add $15 for Tier 1-5 perks.)

Before you decide on a perk, check out the additional Tiers below 
to help us reach our Stretch Goals!


Our Stretch Goals for the Truly Studious!

In addition to all the coming changes to the school system brought on by the Common Core Initiative, the College Board recently dropped a bombshell: the most dramatic changes to the SAT test, perhaps ever!

At ACI, we have always prided ourselves on our ability to create original study materials and practice tests that closely match the difficulty level and expectations of actual SAT tests. As soon as the College Board releases more information, we will be hard at work creating a curriculum to help students prepare for this newest version of the SAT test. As part of our goals of expanding our publication department, we intend to make a test prep book available to students everywhere, the Ultimate Guide to the NEW SAT!

Overall, we are hoping for a strong response to our Memory-Flash system. Certainly, if there is widespread interest, we will be investing in the production of Set B of our Memory-Flash Vocab Flash Cards! 500 additional words, again using our patent pending system of symbols, associations, and memory triggers! As excited as we are to create Set B, we can only hope you're just as excited and will help us meet this second stretch goal to offset the rather exorbitant printing costs.

NOTE: If we do reach our second stretch goal, anyone who is getting a box of Memory-Flash Vocab Cards as a perk can specify whether to receive Set A or Set B!!!

We hope many people will see the value of our learning systems and will be interested in helping us reach these publication goals, enabling ACI Publishing to gain a strong, initial foundation in the field of educational publishing. Perhaps, however, you are just interested in obtaining either of these products as a perk. In either case, your best option is to go for one of our advanced tiers:

(Shipping is included with all perks.
For International shipping, add $25 for Tier 6-8 perks.)

[Keep in mind that receipt of the SAT Guide is contingent upon our reaching our 1st Stretch Goal. Similarly, if we do not reach our 2nd Stretch Goal, Tier 8 will come with two boxes of SET A of the Memory Flash Vocab Cards.]

[Also, realize that the Expected Delivery Date of June 2014 does not apply to SET B of the Vocab Cards or the SAT Guide, as the expected publication date for these products is Fall 2014 and Spring 2015, respectively.]


We appreciate your support!

We hope you've enjoyed learning about our Memory-Flash Vocab System and our goals to develop further educational projects to help students everywhere and to further the quest to create a literate and knowledgeable world.

Even if you feel that our products are not right for you, I'm sure there's someone out there -- perhaps a young person, some diligent and ambitious student -- who could benefit from them, so we would appreciate it if you could pass the word along. Maybe your friend has a daughter who's prepping for a coming test. Maybe you know someone who's just been eager to improve his or her vocabulary. Whatever the case, we would love your support regardless.

Please help us to spread the word by using Indiegogo's share tools to add us to your Facebook page, your Twittering tweets, or whatever social media you prefer.

If you like, you are also free to use the image below, either in digital or printed format, to help us spread the word over the coming weeks.


"One forgets words as one forgets names. One's vocabulary needs constant fertilizing or it will die." -- Evelyn Waugh

story: .

Hey! My name is Caitlin Moore. I'm 18 & from Charleston, WV. I just found out a few days ago that I've been accepted to NYU Tisch for BFA Theatre, and was offered a significant scholarship! This is a dream come true! Unfortunately, my current financial situation does not allow for me to make the required $1,500 deposit - $500 to enroll and another $1000 for housing. But you can help!

By contributing to my campaign, you are helping be experience the opportunity of a lifetime. The chance to study acting in the Big Apple is not one that comes every day! Even if I don't reach my goal of $1000, every penny I do receive will be used to pay my deposit. If I go over my goal, the extra money will go towards the rest of the deposit, and then towards those parts of my tuition not covered by my scholarship.

What will you get in return? My undying gratitude, of course. But that's not all!

Donating:

$5 - a shout out on Facebook and Twitter.

$10 - a personal thank you note personalized just for you! (plus $5 reward)

$15 - a short poem on the topic of your choosing (plus $5 reward)

Unfortunately, my current financial situation does not allow for me to make the required $1,500 deposit - $500 to enroll and another $1000 for housing. But you can help!By contributing to my campaign, you are helping be experience the opportunity of a lifetime. The chance to study acting in the Big Apple is not one that comes every day! If I go over my goal, the extra money will go towards the rest of the deposit, and then towards those parts of my tuition not covered by my scholarship.What will you get in return? story:
Join us in launching our Pilot Program! 

The UnityWorks Foundation is a nonprofit on a mission to promote an understanding of the oneness of humanity, the value of diversity and the need for unity. We provide training, materials and support to empower local communities to raise prejudice-free children, and encourage schools to develop learning environments where students from all backgrounds can be successful. We hope to grow our startup organization into a national force, with programs in multiple cities, helping thousands of teachers and students to learn about unity in diversity.

Our UnityWorks School Program is designed to educate staff and students about living in a diverse society, to promote culturally-responsive teaching, to increase equity and reduce prejudice, to improve race relations, to close achievement and opportunity gaps, and to encourage positive multicultural change.

We plan to launch this fall in Yakima, Washington, beginning with an intensive Training Institute for local teachers.

Where did we get this idea?

Have you ever wondered, “Why can’t we all get along?” That was UnityWorks founder Dr. Randie Gottlieb’s question. As a teacher educator and diversity trainer who has worked and traveled in over 30 countries, she encountered far too many examples of prejudice and discrimination around the world. Instead of becoming discouraged, she decided to devote her efforts to bringing about greater understanding, unity and justice—beginning with our teachers and our schools. 

She found that educators had little training and confidence in this area, and were unsure of how to deal with issues of race, gender, class, or other dimensions of diversity. So Dr. Gottlieb and a small team of like-minded individuals established the UnityWorks Foundation to address these issues in a positive and inclusive manner. We chose the name “UnityWorks” because it does!

Award-winning model

The UnityWorks School Program is based on the award-winning EMPIRE Program, for which Dr. Gottlieb served as Executive Director for over a decade. EMPIRE (Exemplary Multicultural Practices in Rural Education) was a consortium of K-12 schools, businesses and community groups in Washington State that had joined together in a collaborative network to encourage positive multicultural change.

Rather than asking the schools to implement a series of standardized multicultural directives from above, EMPIRE offered pro-active leadership with a grassroots approach that empowered site teams at each school to design and implement their own agendas for change.

As a result of the notable success achieved by the participating schools, EMPIRE was highlighted as a model program by President Clinton's National Initiative on Race; received the Year 2000 Best Program Award from the National Association for Multicultural Education; and was honored with the Washington State Golden Apple Award for Excellence in Education.

Because of their efforts, site teams reported that discipline referrals had declined, long-standing stereotypes were breaking down, cross-race friendships had formed, members of rival groups were working and playing together for the first time, student attendance and motivation had increased, parent involvement more than tripled, and community relations were greatly improved. 

What the teachers said

Kathleen: “It's been really fun and successful for me to incorporate diversity ideas into my classroom. The kids love it too. We're talking about human relationships and the students are beginning to change their words and their actions.”

Ruben: “I now feel a responsibility as a teacher. I am driven to examine my own instructional methods and my own behavior.”

Heriberto: “I am becoming aware of my own prejudices. I thought that I was aware, since I myself have been a victim of racial discrimination. But we cannot ignore prejudice. We must help eradicate it by starting with ourselves.”

Rebecca: “I used to think that one voice did not make an impact, but that has changed. I believe that we will be able to bring this message of understanding to our own schools, our families, our communities.”


Why unity? 

The human race faces many difficult challenges including widespread poverty, malnutrition, war, disease, climate change, economic instability, gender inequality and deep-rooted prejudices. Racial prejudice is particularly damaging. Although great strides have been made, it still pervades the institutions of our society and holds a strong grip on individual hearts and minds. Many children already hold negative stereotypes of other racial and ethnic groups by the time they enter first grade.

While we might make some progress addressing each of these issues separately, UnityWorks believes that they are only pieces of a larger puzzle— symptoms of the primary disease afflicting society: the disunity of the human race. We believe that a fragmented approach is itself part of the problem, and that unity is a prerequisite for achieving the well-being, peace and security of all the earth’s inhabitants. As a united humanity, we will have the capacity to develop positive and sustainable solutions to the challenges facing us, and provide a firm foundation on which to build a prosperous and peaceful world.

Why schools?

Learning about unity and overcoming prejudice should not be considered optional add-ons to the curriculum. Rather, they are a critical part of the education of every child. Working with schools has a multiplier effect, since a single teacher can reach thousands of students, and these young people will then influence every sector of society.

“While realizing that we cannot entirely solve the problems which exist between cultures, we also realize that somebody has to start somewhere—starting with ourselves as individuals, spreading to our school and ultimately to our community.” (School District Superintendent)



What have we done so far?

Our first UnityWorks PowerPoint series for school children (on the topics of Unity, Diversity, Skin Colors and Overcoming Prejudice) has been downloaded over 500 times. Our recently-published 300-page activity book on Teaching Unity is already being used by educators in 18 countries -- including China, with over 8,000 public school children as part of the World Ambassador Program in Shanghai.

The book was also honored in 2013 as an IP Notable by Independent Publisher Magazine, which called it “a title of distinction…As important as the ABCs and the 123s.” And in May 2014, Teaching Unity was named a Finalist in the Education/Academic category for both the Next Generation Book Awards and the National Indie Excellence Awards.

Next steps

Our next goal is to establish a UnityWorks School Program in Yakima, Washington during the 2014-15 school year—providing diversity training, educational materials and ongoing support to site teams at several local schools.

We have recruited a diverse and experienced local volunteer board to coordinate this effort, and are in the process of enrolling interested schools. We will also design the curriculum for a 30-hour intensive Teacher Training Institute this Fall; create the instructional materials for that training; and plan a follow-up conference for site teams in the spring.

The Training Institute will help prepare educators with essential knowledge, practical skills, and specific strategies needed to help them design and implement successful projects in their own classrooms and schools. Hands-on interactive workshops will include sessions on: 

  • Dimensions of Diversity
  • Multiple Perspectives in the Curriculum
  • Culture and Communication
  • The Reality of Race
  • Bullying and Biased Remarks
  • Equity, Expectations and Student Achievement
  • The Power of Language
  • Prejudice, Power and Privilege
  • Role of Whites in a Multicultural Society
  • Creating an Action Plan

The UnityWorks Training Institute will become an annual event open to new site teams who are ready to launch the Program at their own schools. With experience and an established model, we’ll move forward with plans to expand to additional cities across the United States and beyond.

What will the funds be used for?

Our plan is to build a scalable model that will serve as the basis for a nationwide program. This campaign is in support of Phase 1, which has five primary goals.

Five primary goals:

  1. Design and carry out an intensive 30-hour Training Institute for up to 40 teachers (including trainer fees, guest speakers, facility rental, books, equipment, refreshments and supplies).
  2. Develop the curriculum and all training materials, including PowerPoints and handouts.
  3. Create a website, brochures and other promotional materials to assist in recruiting schools.
  4. Provide seed funding for the initial site team projects at each school.
  5. Hold a spring conference to provide an opportunity for teams to report on their challenges and successes, evaluate their efforts, share best practices, and make plans for the following year.

The funds will also be used to cover the costs of site visits and ongoing administrative support.

If we exceed our funding goal for the current school year, we plan to use the additional money to provide teachers with college credits or continuing education clock hours for the training.

Risks and challenges

As with any new school-based program, we will need to work around existing schedules, availability of funds and personnel, and other challenges that might affect our delivery dates, but we will do everything we can to complete each task well and on time.

We need your help!

First and foremost, we welcome your financial support! There is a lot of work to be done to eliminate prejudice and create unity, and there are real costs associated with launching and growing a long-term initiative like this. (Did we mention we were thinking big?)

Second, we'd love your help in spreading the word about this fundraiser and about the UnityWorks Foundation. By sharing on Facebook, Twitter, G+ or your favorite online and face-to-face networks, you increase our chances of preparing more teachers and schools to dismantle people-made barriers and help create a society where all feel welcome, where differences are valued, and where people are treated with dignity and respect. 

The UnityWorks Team:  Randie, Steve, Beth, Jonathan, Roya, Jordan

Donation levels and perks

You can buy in for only $5—less than the cost of a hamburger and fries!  For each higher level, you will also receive the perks for levels 1 and 2, plus regular project updates and opportunities to provide input as we move forward.  

BONUS!  In addition to the perks described here, the first 10 contributors at $250 and above will receive a special a cappella singing Skypegram (worldwide) or phone call (U.S.) from Roya to you or a friend!  You can pick from a list of 10 songs.  

Note:  UnityWorks is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit corporation registered in Washington State. Donations are tax-deductible.

story:
Hi everybody!

My name is Ana, 22 years old,  and I've finished my Bachelor in Physics - Astronomy and Astrophysics branch, in Lisbon. Studying what's happening outside our lovely little planet is my dream since childhood, and so I want to go to Leiden, The Netherlands, to do a Msc in Astronomy. Leiden University is really good in this field, as I already experienced, this year, through a summer internship, but to be able to study abroad I'll need funding. I've already been accepted, but there were no scholarships available to start in February, neither in The Netherlands or Portugal, and so I don't have much money to start studying and may have to give up on my dream to go to Leiden and study the Universe. 
Considering this I'm asking for your precious help for this semester.

---
Fees: 1906€
Housing+food: ~550 x 6 (six months)
---

Many many thanks *

story:
School of HONK is a place we all learn to play together. We are people of all ages and musical backgrounds who have banded together to have fun parading through our neighborhood every Sunday afternoon, playing lively, loud brass music to help heal and bind our community together.

We are already 50 members strong, and we want to double our size in 2015.

Organized by members of the Second Line Brass Band and Somerville's annual HONK! Festival, our school's mentor musicians have enjoyed many years of fun and self-discovery playing in dozens of street bands, for literally hundreds of parades and other special occasions. We want to share what we have learned, and continue learning ourselves, about how to have the most fun and the biggest, loudest impact on those around us.


          

Anyone and everyone can make music

We believe everyone is a potential musician: whether horn player, drummer, singer, dancer or flag waver, even for beginners who have never cultivated their own musicianship. We want others to know and share the joy that comes from an all-inclusive, supportive and liberating space for making spontaneous music together. We play groovy music to get people dancing, the way our ancestors played, before the internet, before radio, before concert halls, even before language itself. Just like any other play, honking in the streets succeeds best when it follows some basic rules and helpful conventions. So we draw our lessons from the history, repertoire and inspiration of similar and beloved brass and drum street bands around the world, and especially the activist brass band revival underway across the nation and beyond. 

In just a few short weeks, we've already made 5 fun tunes our own: Environmental Encroachment’s Rock Anthem, Rude Mechanical Orchestra’s arrangement of Cariñito, Rebirth Brass Band’s Do Watcha Wanna, Ray Parker Jr’s Ghostbusters Theme, and Michael Jackson’s Billie Jean. Best of all, we have already shared our songs with hundreds of smiling and dancing onlookers during our first 10 parades of fun and adventure in the Davis Square neighborhood. 


             

What we need & what you get

But to keep moving forward, and reach out to potential students in our larger community, we need your help:
  • Your time: For just two hours a week, we want to show you (and your friends) how much fun you can have sharing music and laughter with your friends and neighbors. We meet every Sunday, 3-5 pm, at 339R Summer St. in Somerville.
  • Your instrument donations: Maybe you, or someone you know, has a woodwind or brass or other instrument to donate to our cause. Perhaps you have an old trumpet in the attic, or a spare baritone sax you haven't played in years. Working order is preferred, but even a broken instrument might be very useful to us, and help unlock someone’s inner honk. To arrange for instrument pick-up, write to schoolofhonk@gmail.com.
  • Your money donations: We need to repair those extra instruments our school has already acquired, and also cover some other incidental expenses to help get the word out about our school. Check out all our musical perks here in exchange for your generous money donations! (All donations are tax deductible.)
  • Your voice: Help us make a loud noise with our campaign by spreading the word. Maybe you know someone else who would love to make music with us, or a friend with an old clarinet they aren't using, or someone else who might want to donate to our school. If so, please share our campaign with them so they can join our cause.

Students and friends of the school have already contributed 2 bass drums and 3 snare drums, as well as a flute, an alto sax,  a trombone and a pBone (what's that?). Our goal is to acquire all kinds of extra horns and other noisemakers of every type, and find newcomers to play each one, so we can double our size in the coming months.

Donate if you can. But most importantly, give yourself and your friends the gift of HONK and come check us out some Sunday soon.


(Find more pictures, videos and other details at facebook.com/schoolofhonk )

story:
Become part of history by funding the #SAVETHESLIPPERS campaign and help find out what happened to the missing Ruby Slippers, stolen in 2005.



A pair of the Ruby Slippers are missing.


The case remains open.


Hi, I'm filmmaker Morgan White. For the past two years I've been documenting the unbelievable story of the Ruby Slippers from The Wizard of Oz for my upcoming film, The Slippers, set to be released next year. Now I want you to be a part of their amazing story with the #SAVETHESLIPPERS campaign, by helping to raise the funds necessary to solve the case of the missing pair.

Four pairs of Ruby Slippers that were used in the 1939 MGM classic film The Wizard of Oz are known to exist. They are among the most important pieces of Hollywood memorabilia, worth millions of dollars, and were worn by legendary star Judy Garland as she skipped down the yellow brick road in the film. 

One pair resides at The Smithsonian Institution in Washington, DC, and has been on display for nearly 40 years, attracting millions each year. A second pair will be the centerpiece of The Academy Museum (AMPAS Museum) which is set to open to the public in Los Angeles, CA, in 2017. The third pair is privately owned, locked away in a bank vault where no one can see them. 

As for the fourth pair...

Each year the Judy Garland Museum in Grand Rapids, Minnesota, birthplace of Judy Garland, hosts a festival celebrating Judy and the wonderful world of Oz, and noted Hollywood collector Michael Shaw had been lending his shoes to the museum for display during the festival. They drew in countless fans from all over the world.

But in 2005 the shoes went missing...

On August 28th, 2005, someone broke into the Judy Garland Museum and stole the authentic pair of Ruby Slippers that were on display. The case was investigated by the local police, who came to no conclusions, and as time went on the case went cold...

Now 10 years later...

Minneapolis based Alexander & Associates, a private investigation company who specializes in cold cases, was brought in to save the Ruby Slippers. The investigators are close to solving the case once and for all, but we need your help to raise the funds necessary to complete the final critical stages of the investigation before the case goes cold again. All funds raised will go directly to the investigation.

The investigation requires a further $45,000 to help solve the case.

You can be a part of this historic effort to #SAVETHESLIPPERS.




The Ruby Slippers are considered to be the most important piece of Hollywood memorabilia, and are a totem for millions of fans all over the world. The most recent sale put their value at over 2 million dollars per pair, and that value will continue to climb in the future.

When a pair of shoes were stolen from The Judy Garland Museum in 2005 it was considered a major art theft, but the case went cold. Over the past 10 years stories of their location have continued to circulate, leaving people, including their previous owner Michael Shaw, accused of a crime they did not commit. It is time to put a stop to all the stories, rumors, and hearsay. Let's find the shoes once and for all!

The shoes currently on display at the Smithsonian Institution in Washington, DC draw in millions of fans from all over the world each year, and remain one of the museum's most viewed exhibits. The Ruby Slippers were made to be seen. All pairs of them. They are a direct connection that takes us to the wonderful land of Oz.

With the #SAVETHESLIPPERS campaign you'll become a part of their story, and  help save a part of Hollywood history for millions more to see.



About Alexander & Associates


As with all open investigations, many details cannot be shared for fear of jeopardizing the case. The PIs at Alexander & Associates are currently in the final stages of their investigation, but there is still much work to be done.

The theft of the iconic Ruby Slippers generated international discussion, and because of that, much time and money have been spent disproving many of the theories that circulated.

"We have the experience required for working high-profile cases and we are good at what we do. We have spent the past two years gathering facts, and reconstructing and analyzing the events that took place in 2005. As a result of our investigation we are on the proper path to resolving this matter. Investigations require time, money, and tenacity. We want to close this matter and bring home the slippers!" 

- Alexander & Associates



For the #SAVETHESLIPPERS campaign we are offering a number of perks to say thanks for your support in this historic event.




$10 - I Helped #SAVETHESLIPPERS

Congrats, you're now a part of history! We'll put your name in the special #SAVETHESLIPPERS funders section of the end credits of The Slippers documentary.


$15 - #SAVETHESLIPPERS Button

You'll get your very own I HELPED #SAVETHESLIPPERS button delivered right to your mailbox! Your name will also be added to the special #SAVETHESLIPPERS funders section of the end credits of The Slippers documentary. Please note that a mailing address is required for this perk. 


$20 - Digital Copy of The Slippers

You'll get a digital download of The Slippers documentary when it is completed early next year. Your name will also be added to the special #SAVETHESLIPPERS funders section of the end credits. Please note that a mailing address is required for this perk.


$40 - #SAVETHESLIPPERS T-Shirt

You'll get your very own #SAVETHESLIPPERS T-Shirt to show your friends that you took part in this historic event! Your name will also be added to the special #SAVETHESLIPPERS funders section of the end credits of The Slippers documentary. Please note that a mailing address is required for this perk.   (All shirts will be Large Size.)


$50 - Collectors Edition of The Slippers Documentary on Blu-Ray & DVD

You'll get your very own collectors edition Blu-Ray/DVD combo of The Slippers documentary when it's completed early next year. Your name will also be added to the special #SAVETHESLIPPERS funders section of the end credits. Please note that a mailing address is required for this perk.


$75 - The Ruby Slippers of Oz Book

You'll get your very own copy of The Ruby Slippers of Oz by Rhys Thomas. This book is long out of print, and is a great addition to any film fan's library. Your name will also be added to the special #SAVETHESLIPPERS funders section of the end credits of The Slippers documentary. Please note that a mailing address is required for this perk.


$100 -  T-Shirt and The Slippers Documentary on Blu-Ray & DVD

You'll get both a #SAVETHESLIPPERS T-Shirt as well as the collectors edition Blu-Ray/DVD combo of The Slippers documentary when it's completed early next year. Your name will also be added to the special #SAVETHESLIPPERS funders section of the end credits. Please note that a mailing address is required for this perk.


$500 - #SAVETHESLIPPERS Plaque

Your name will be inscribed on a plaque that will be prominently displayed at the Judy Garland Museum in Grand Rapids, MN. Your name will also be a part of the special #SAVETHESLIPPERS funders section of the end credits of The Slippers documentary. The plaque will be unveiled during the 2016 Judy Garland Festival.


$1000 - Associate Producer Credit on The Slippers

You'll become an associate producer of the upcoming documentary The Slippers! You'll also receive all of the previous perks. Please note that a mailing address is required for this perk.


$5000 - Skype Chat with the Investigators & Executive Producer Credit (only 3 available)

Chat live with the Private Investigators of Alexander & Associates about their work on the investigation. This is a rare opportunity, and we're offering only three chances to chat with them, so act fast! You'll also receive all of the other perks. Please note that a mailing address is required for this perk.






The fascinating story of the Ruby Slippers is now the subject of an upcoming feature length documentary, The Slippers, which is currently in production by Tricon Films & Television.

"After reading The Ruby Slippers of Oz by Rhys Thomas I was instantly drawn to the unbelievable story of the Ruby Slippers, and their importance to Hollywood history. The life of the shoes after production wrapped on The Wizard of Oz is as amazing a tale as the 1939 MGM classic, and their impact on film fans and pop culture is unlike any other piece of Hollywood memorabilia. They are the catalyst to a now multi-million dollar a year industry of costume collecting, helped spark the push for preservation of costumes and props in Hollywood, and remain a totem for film fans the world over. The shoes are a direct connection to both Oz and the idea that there is no place like home. They are all-consuming, and grab the attention of all who see them. I'm so proud to be able to bring this fascinating story to a wider audience with my upcoming film, The Slippers. I grew up a film fan watching Oz, and it gives me great pleasure to be documenting the world that grew out of the indelible classic, and I can't wait to share it with all of you!" - Morgan White (Producer/Director of The Slippers)

The Slippers will be completed for release in early 2016, and will be available across all markets and platforms. Any questions about the production of The Slippers can be directed to Morgan White at morganwhite@triconfilms.com.

About Tricon Films & Television


Tricon Films & Television is one of North America’s strongest independent production and distribution companies dedicated to producing and representing groundbreaking television.

Established in 2000, Tricon Films and Television is widely recognized as one of North America’s leading independent film and television production companies. From their offices in Toronto and Los Angeles, Tricon creates innovative, entertaining, high-quality media for both North America and international markets. Tricon prides itself on exceeding the expectation of clients with a slate of award-winning projects that include lifestyle programming, children’s programming, documentaries, feature films and digital media.

For more information please visit Tricon Films & Television



This is your chance to be a part of the fascinating story of The Ruby Slippers, and a part of Hollywood History. Please donate to the #SAVETHESLIPPERS so that the shoes don’t remain lost forever.

If you have any information on the whereabouts of the stolen Ruby Slippers please contact Alexander & Associates directly at 612-824-2442.

Become part of history by funding the #SAVETHESLIPPERS campaign and help find out what happened to the missing Ruby Slippers, stolen in 2005.
A pair of the Ruby Slippers are missing.


The case remains open.
Hi, I'm filmmaker Morgan White. For the past two years I've been documenting the unbelievable story of the Ruby Slippers from The Wizard of Oz for my upcoming film, The Slippers, set to be released next year. Now I want you to be a part of their amazing story with the #SAVETHESLIPPERS campaign, by helping to raise the funds necessary to solve the case of the missing pair.
Four pairs of Ruby Slippers that were used in the 1939 MGM classic film The Wizard of Oz are known to exist. They are among the most important pieces of Hollywood memorabilia, worth millions of dollars, and were worn by legendary star Judy Garland as she skipped down the yellow brick road in the film. One pair resides at The Smithsonian Institution in Washington, DC, and has been on display for nearly 40 years, attracting millions each year. A second pair will be the centerpiece of The Academy Museum (AMPAS Museum) which is set to open to the public in Los Angeles, CA, in 2017. The third pair is privately owned, locked away in a bank vault where no one can see them. As for the fourth pair...

Each year the Judy Garland Museum in Grand Rapids, Minnesota, birthplace of Judy Garland, hosts a festival celebrating Judy and the wonderful world of Oz, and noted Hollywood collector Michael Shaw had been lending his shoes to the museum for display during the festival. They drew in countless fans from all over the world.

But in 2005 the shoes went missing...

On August 28th, 2005, someone broke into the Judy Garland Museum and stole the authentic pair of Ruby Slippers that were on display. The case was investigated by the local police, who came to no conclusions, and as time went on the case went cold...


Now 10 years later...

The investigation requires a further $45,000 to help solve the case.

story:
Short Summary

 We are a group of six highly motivated teenagers who are part of the Desert Academy Leos Club. Our mission is to build a classroom in the community of Desab, in Haiti, and to educate the school’s students about the importance of clean water. The village we will be working in consists primarily of farmhouses, a small clinic, and a rundown school. Our work will benefit the 300+ children who attend the school, many of whom suffer from malnutrition due to a lack of clean water supply. Desab is very much in need of support and we are excited to make a difference!

What We Need

As you might imagine, our trip requires a tremendous amount of funding. Although we have made a good start raising money so far, we still need a lot of support to make this trip happen. Any size donation would be appreciated, as we aim to raise around $ 15,000 in total. We are extremely grateful for your support!

The Impact

In a nation such as Haiti, education is the key to success. Especially in the countryside, a strong education is difficult to come by - which makes school facilities all the more valuable for children living in rural areas. By providing the students attending school in Desab with a new classroom in which they can learn and thrive, we hope to truly make a difference.

Risks & Challenges

On this service trip, we will be immersing ourselves in an entirely new culture. The village of Desab is about as rural as you can get, with outdoor community showers, primitive outhouses, and no internet nor outside contact of any kind. Part of what will make this experience so incredible is that we are going to have to adapt to new situations and go without all the modern technology we take for granted in our daily lives.

Other Ways You Can Help

We fully recognize that not everyone can contribute to our project. However, if you would still like to help, we would greatly appreciate it if you would tell your friends about our project, and click the Indiegogo share tool below!

story:
THE STORY

My name is Ren Morrison and I am the Director of Community Programs for Atlantic Center for the Arts (ACA). ACA is a nonprofit interdisciplinary artists' community and arts education facility dedicated to promoting artistic excellence for over thirty-eight years.

I run many programs, but, by far, the one most important to me is our your word teen writing residency. Created more than eight years ago by poet and author Kelle Groom and myself, your word is a two-week, immersive writing residency that takes place at ACA’s world class facilities located in a pristine, Florida woodlands setting.

The residency brings together teen writers from all over the country and provides them with the unique experience of working with well-published Master Writers of different genres. Each writer is given their own room and the space and freedom to explore the breadth of their creativity. The residency is a transformative experience not only in regards to writing, but also in regards to how the teens are treated—they are treated as equals, as adults.

WHAT WE NEED

For the majority of years the residency has been in existence we enjoyed the financial support of a foundation. This support allowed us to give out many scholarships to teens who would otherwise be unable to attend. The term of this funding ended a year ago and so did our ability to provide scholarships to those in need.

We need your scholarship donations to maintain the kind of diversity, socio-economic and otherwise, that we have been striving for from day one. Last year this campaign provided scholarships for three inner-city teens from Cleveland and Milwaukee, and this year we would like to double that. Our $12,000 goal will allow us to give out six full scholarships to talented teen writers of color (African American and Hispanic).

If we don’t reach our goal of $12,000, any funds raised will be used to provide as much assistance as possible.

THE IMPACT

Surrounded by a residency staff of which about 90% are writers, the teens are exposed to writers who are at various stages of their careers (recent graduates, grad students, emerging writers, and established writers). This gives the teens access to writers of various experience levels and allows them to see that pursuing their passion for writing is a viable career option. Also important is the community that quickly develops among the teens, a community the teens can and do draw upon long after they've left the residency. Without question, the your word residency is a transformative experience for young writers.

Any amount you can donate will help, and whether you can or can’t donate, please share this campaign with as many people as you can. Indiegogo has share tools to help you with this.

Thanks.
