story:
Our Mission!

Out & About, a division of Imagine!, makes a positive difference in the lives of people with developmental disabilities through community-based, therapeutic services.
We strongly believe in the potential of all and support Imagine!’s guiding philosophy that all individuals, regardless of ability or disability, have talents and strengths to contribute as vital members of their communities.

About Us!

Imagine!’s Out & About Children's Program offers an After School Program and Summer Day Camp for children with developmental disabilities in a community setting. 
This year we launched our first annual Centre Stage for Kids program! To support Out & About’s mission and vision of community involvement we have gathered support from the City of Lafayette, BackStory Theatre, BVSD Parent Engagement Network, Centaurus High School and Alchemy of Movement.  
The kids in the program have had the opportunity to learn about stage movement, improvisation, memorization, vocal projection, team-work, and theatre basics. We're so excited about our upcoming final performance in April! This will be a showcase of individual expression and be an opportunity for each actor to express themselves in their own unique wonderful way. 

Why We Need Your Help:

Our intention is to run Centre Stage for Kids as an authentic, professional production and we need your assistance in order to keep up with the costs of this new program.

Costs include:

  • Rehearsal space rental  
  • Performance facility rental
  • Costumes 
  • Props
  • Set Designs
  • Facilitation/Director Fees

All donations will go directly to the Out & About Children's Program and Centre Stage for Kids. 

Please help us continue to provide this opportunity for our participants and their families. 

Spread the word by sharing our campaign on Facebook!

Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

We are a group of students from the University of Salford. We are currently trying to raise money for our final degree show to fund our final photography exhibition.

This campaign is important for us as we need the funding to help us pay for a space to exhibit in, and the materials to do so. We want our degree show to highlight all of the students that are a part of it and a bit of extra funding will help us do so. 

If successful, we will achieve an outstanding exhibition which will help us show professionalism and talent. Our work will speak for itself, however this funding will help us stand out from the crowd.


What We Need

We need about £1000 to help us on our way with this exhibition and all the donations will be going to this. We believe that our course holds some outstanding fresh talent which should be celebrated. 

If we do not reach our entire goal, all the money will still be contributed to the exhibition, and we will be using other fund raising ideas to help us reach our goal!


The Impact

By helping us, and donating, you are creating a platform where young talent and flourish into the photography world. We may have the next Nick Knight in our class. Important magazine editors and valuable people in the industry will visit this exhibition, so a professional outlook will give us a higher chance of succeeding in the industry after we leave university.

Risks & Challenges

We understand that we may not reach this goal of £1000. This will not stop us, we will be having bake sales amongst other things to try and reach this target. I am aware there may be many obstacles on the way to this target but we have backup plans if we do not reach it. Nevertheless, all of this money will be contributed to our final amount raised. 


Thankyou 
- University of Salford Photography students

Short Summary
 We are a group of students from the University of Salford. We are currently trying to raise money for our final degree show to fund our final photography exhibition.
This campaign is important for us as we need the funding to help us pay for a space to exhibit in, and the materials to do so. We want our degree show to highlight all of the students that are a part of it and a bit of extra funding will help us do so. 
If successful, we will achieve an outstanding exhibition which will help us show professionalism and talent. Our work will speak for itself, however this funding will help us stand out from the crowd.
   What We Need We need about £1000 to help us on our way with this exhibition and all the donations will be going to this. We believe that our course holds some outstanding fresh talent which should be celebrated. 
If we do not reach our entire goal, all the money will still be contributed to the exhibition, and we will be using other fund raising ideas to help us reach our goal!
   The Impact
By helping us, and donating, you are creating a platform where young talent and flourish into the photography world. We may have the next Nick Knight in our class. Important magazine editors and valuable people in the industry will visit this exhibition, so a professional outlook will give us a higher chance of succeeding in the industry after we leave university.
   Risks & Challenges We understand that we may not reach this goal of £1000. This will not stop us, we will be having bake sales amongst other things to try and reach this target. I am aware there may be many obstacles on the way to this target but we have backup plans if we do not reach it. Nevertheless, all of this money will be contributed to our final amount raised. 
    
Thankyou - University of Salford Photography students

story:
On November 2, 2012 a super cool kid named Coltrane was born in Oakland, CA. When he was 9 days old his parents learned that he has Joubert Syndrome (JS), a very rare neurological birth defect that affects about 1 in 100,000 children. JS can cause low muscle tone, intellectual disabilities, altered breathing patterns, ataxia/poor muscle coordination, global developments delay, vision issues, GI issues and additional medical complications. Coltrane is 2 years old and works hard everyday at learning how to walk, talk, and eat like his peers. He receives Occupational, Speech, Physical, and Vision Therapy as well as Early Intervention services. He excels at sorting match box cars, painting pictures, singing, flipping through books, and charming the heck out of everyone he meets. 

Joubert Syndrome is very rare, it affects about 0.00001% of the American population. That's a tiny number! Because of this, we don't know any local families that are affected by it, and most of our doctors are learning as we go. The Joubert Syndrome and Related Disorders Foundation hosts a bi-annual conference that unites families, researchers, and health care professionals affected by this syndrome and this year the conference will be in Chicago from July 22-25. Coltrane and his Mom went to the conference in 2012 and it was a transformational experience. This year, Coltrane and both his parents want to make the journey, but we need your help to get there.


What these funds will pay for:

  • Airfare for Coltrane & his parents from Oakland to Chicago (Est. $1200)
  • Hotel stay during conference (Est. $600)
  • Conference registration fees ($450)
  • Recoup materials & shipping costs for donation perks, IndieGogo and credit card processing fees ( Est. $650)
In addition to covering these costs, this fundraiser will raise money to help other families who need help getting to the conference. 10% of all funds raised by this campaign, plus any additional funds over our $3000 goal will be donated to the JSRDF foundation conference scholarships fund to help other families attend the conference.

Donation Perks
We've put together some fun perks to help sweeten your donations. Inspired by the hallmark feature of Joubert Syndrome, a brain abnormality called the molar tooth sign,  Coltrane's Auntie Carol Sevilla designed a beautiful molar tooth mandala graphic. We have used this image to create postcards, hand silk screen beautiful bandanas, and even make some t-shirts! We are extra excited about the bandanas as they have each been uniquely hand printed at home. Shipping of perks within North America or local delivery (Bay Area) is included with your donation. 

Postcards 
We don't want to spoil the snail mail surprise, so we are keeping the design on the down low. Rest assured it will be lovely! 


Bandanas 


T-shirts 

THANK YOU!

story:
March 28-29 | Tallahassee, FL | Free Admission

We are proud to announce that FreeCon is returning for its eleventh year, and we would like to invite you to contribute to FreeCon through crowdfunding. We have been working tirelessly for the past eight months to create a large scale event that has a unique story, characters, and interactive events that will make your experience one to remember. Of course, with such big plans, we cannot do it alone.

Right now we are looking at some high-profile media guests, quality programming, and equipment necessary to make it all happen. In years past, we have utilized funding granted by our university and from our own pockets. However, with such quality programming lined up, this simply is not enough. With your support, we can bring everything we have planned to life.

As the new directors of FreeCon, we are honored to carry on such a wonderful legacy. Inheriting this ambitious project has been a memorable experience unlike any other, and we want to encourage the administrative team to make this the best event possible. FreeCon has always been an event for fans by fans, and we want to make it stand out not only as an annual Tallahassee event, but as a free college run convention. Most of all, we hope that all of you will get the most of out FreeCon and enjoy every moment of the experience. This convention means a lot to us, and your donations will be greatly appreciated.

Amanda Ellard, Ginny Fouts, and Norma Ortiz
FreeCon Directors


FreeCon is an annual Japanese animation, science fiction, video game, comic book, and enthusiast convention held in Tallahassee, Florida. This year, two tribe leaders will face conflict greater than either of them can overcome alone and discover:

"The Truth Cannot Hide Forever"

FreeCon will be held at the Florida State University, a large venue we have been proud to call home for more than ten years. Check out the Vendor Room and the Artist Alley, and get yourself some awesome swag. The Costume Contest will also be returning this year, along with the AMV contest, and a variety of other contests. Interact with fellow fans in a panel and enjoy many more events!

Immerse yourself in the mystical tribes of Oasis and Dune, and join this year's heroes, Ranzai and Ren, as they fight to maintain the balance of their worlds. The quest for peace begins on Saturday, March 28th and ends on Sunday, March 29th. Oasis and Dune will never be the same, so take a stand with your tribe in the face of adversity!

As always, FreeCon is absolutely FREE to attend. So don't miss your chance to try to change fate!

Currently we are in contact with several Media Guests. Although we cannot reveal who they are yet, we can promise that they are faces that must be seen! Remember, the more funding we receive, the more guests we can have.

Our quality programming doesn’t fund itself. Although our university covers some of our expenses, much of it is not. The more you contribute, the more equipment, materials, and prizes can be purchased to make the convention a better experience.

By contributing, you can receive the following perks:



 Buttons
Show your allegiance with these buttons featuring artwork of the FreeCon characters.


Commissions
A variety of artwork produced by our FreeCon Art Team at your request. A breakdown of all styles is listed below.


FreeCon T-Shirt
FreeCon T-Shirts are extremely limited, and since they are free, they go pretty quickly. However, with this perk, we will keep one on hold for you. Just let us know the size shirt you would like to have after you donate.


Personalized Badge
Name tags that feature the name of your choice on top of FreeCon graphics. These are available on the day of the convention.


Prints
High quality limited 8½" x 11" prints printed on matte paper of official FreeCon artwork. Can be signed by the artist upon request.


Maid Cafe Fast Pass
The Maid Cafe is an extremely popular event that sells out quickly. However, if you get this perk, we'll be sure to save you a seat. See you at the Cafe!


DVD
Two siblings -- torn apart in a world of hatred and birthright. Witness the epic of FreeCon: Genesis on your own personal DVD copy of the feature-length live-action film.


Name in Program
We will include your name on a credits page of the FreeCon Program as a special thanks.


Color Poster
A 24''x32'' poster depicting all of the characters for this year’s FreeCon. The FreeCon cinematic poster will make a nice addition to your wall!


Complete Visual Works Artbook
A collection of all the artwork done for FreeCon. It will include the official artwork for all of the characters, promotional artwork, reference sheets, concept art, sketches, notes and commentary from artists, and the winning entries of the FreeCon Drawing Contest--all in glorious high resolution!
Name in Opening Ceremony
We will mention your name during the Opening Ceremonies as one of our top contributors.
Autographed Picture of Mascots
Group photo of the cast of FreeCon: Genesis signed by the actors themselves for your own personal collection.
Limited Print
A special edition limited print of Ren and Ranzai drawn by the lead artist, Tony Nguyen. Only a limited number will be printed, so be sure to claim yours before they are all gone!
Novelization
The epic of FreeCon: Genesis can rest in the palm of your hands. Read it on the bus or before you go to bed.
Card of Appreciation
A personal thank you card from the FreeCon team, to show our gratitude for your generous donation.

Funding will be prioritized to all media guest expenditures. If we cannot reach our goal, those funds will be allocated to events and programming. Needless to say, every dollar you spend will be used to enhance your convention experience.

When you purchase an Art Commission, depending on your contribution level, you can receive one of the following styles of print.

Level C - Digital Sketch Commission: Digital Black and White "chibi" single character (of your choice) drawing done by one of our FreeCon Artists, Angel K. Examples of her work can be found here:[1], [2], [3]. Specifics about the work, along with distribution date, will be negotiated upon purchase.

Level B - Digital Sketch Commission: Digital colored single character (of your choice) drawing done by your choice of FreeCon Artist, Kristina Rodriguez [1], Serene Smallwood [1], [2], or Emma Baird [1], [2]. Choice of the Artist is a first come first served. Specifics about the work, along with distribution date, will be negotiated upon purchase.

Level A - Digital Commission: Digitally colored single character (of your choice) drawing done by one of our FreeCon Artists, Kristina Rodriguez [1]. Specifics about the work, along with distribution date, will be negotiated upon purchase.

Level S - Digital Commission: Digitally illustrated drawing of a single character (of your choice) done by the original FreeCon Mascot Artist, Tony Nguyen, colored by Kristina Rodriguez (Examples: [1], [2], [3], [4]). Specifics about the work, along with distribution date, will be negotiated upon purchase. Explicit content requests are not allowed.

We are college students with a passion for running a free, college-run convention. We are not paid professionals; we just worked from the ground up, learning along the way. We are dedicated to providing this region with a free convention that challenges what a college-run convention can be. Our team of artists, writers, costume designers, and event managers have spent the last eight months creating a theme, characters, a story, and interactive events. It is fans like you who motivate us every day.

Eleven years and running, this brand has stood the test of time, and is growing every year. You have enjoyed FreeCon in the past, and now it's time to contribute towards its future.

Remember to share this campaign among your friends and family! Every dollar amount counts. Contribute to FreeCon today!

story:
We Invite You to Become Part of the Beginning of Our Story at tendy.live

"Hablemos Español"

tendy.live is a video chat platform for learning Spanish, offering students the experience to work one on one, with native, Spanish speaking teachers, licensed in teaching Spanish, available 24/7.

  • All classes are live.
  • Classes by means of immersion in conversation, that facilitate learning.
  • All classes are personalized.
  • 16 adjustable plans at the subscriber's choice, both in time of duration per session, number of sessions per week, and by number of months.
  • Differentiated subscription costs, according to the choice and preference of the plan by the subscriber.

On the tendy.live Platform You Will Find: 

  • Video display where you can join your Spanish teacher for a live, one on one, guided conversation class. 
  • You can choose the Spanish teachers you would like to work with. Teachers available 24/7.
  • A chatbox with an intelligent translator, where you and the teacher can write, read and translate messages as needed. 
  • A whiteboard for writing, drawing and displaying of images, to make the class more interactive and interesting.
  • Video recordings of your classes, which you may access at anytime during your subscription, to review prior classes.

tendy.live Features:

​

Innovative Methodology:

Language Acquisition through Guided Conversation (LAGC) is our innovative methodology to teach and guide the learning of Spanish as a second language. The key component in LAGC methodology is the continuous dialogue. Our teachers are native, Spanish-speaking teachers with a degree in teaching Spanish. They implement this methodology, guiding the conversation, awakening and sustaining the interest and motivation of the student. With purposeful questions, the teacher leads the student to discover the meaning of words or sentences expressed in the conversation, allowing the student to gradually enrich their Spanish language skills, from a basic vocabulary to complex levels of linguistic usability.

Reasons to Start Learning Spanish:

There are more and more people who want to learn Spanish worldwide, either for travel, business, work, study or to communicate with family or friends. Spanish is the third most important language in the world. Approximately 580 million people speak it and it is the official language of 20 countries.

Dare to discover the world in Spanish. Be one of the first to contribute and take advantage of our specially priced plans for a limited time offer. Join tendy.live through Indiegogo and enjoy learning Spanish.

 

Rewards Plan for the Contributors to tendy.live:

The Rewards Plan consists of a special discount on all plans and the contributor’s name, picture or video published on tendy.live’s Wall of Friends once we are in the commercial operating phase. 

  • Up to $14 USD, contributors will have their name published on tendy.live’s Wall of Friends.
  • Basic contributions: $15 USD, one 30 minute class. $45 USD, three 30 minute classes. $75 USD, five 30 minute classes.
  • Charitable contributions from $5 USD to whatever you’d like to donate. These contributions have no associated benefit or reward.

Pre-Opening Plans and Prices:

  • One Month Plan/ 3 classes per week/ 30 minute classes 40% off: Now $84 USD, regular price $140 USD. Price per class $6.47 USD.
  • One Month Plan/ 5 classes per week/ 30 minute classes 40% off: Now $122 USD, regular price $204 USD. Price per class $5.55 USD. 
  • Three Month Plan/ 3 classes per week/ 30 minute classes 45% off: Now $227 USD, regular price $420 USD. Price per class $5.83 USD. .
  • Three Month Plan/ 5 classes per week/ 30 minute classes 45% off: Now $329 USD, regular price $609 USD. Price per class $4.99 USD. 

Wall of Friends: 

The tendy.live Wall of Friends is a place on our website, where we will post videos, pictures and the names of everyone that made a contribution to acquire specially priced pre-opening plans on tendy.live.  

Process and Development:

Other Ways to Help:

It's simple, share the tendy.live campaign with your friends and family, so more people can have a new experience in learning Spanish.

Remember, Sharing is Also Contributing

For more information write us at hello@tendy.live or visit our website: www.tendy.live

Follow us:

https://www.facebook.com/TendyLiveNow
